30.english: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of His mouth shall he go away.

31.hebrew: àÇì-éÇàÂîÅï áÌÇùÌÑÈå ğÄúÀòÈä:    ëÌÄé-ùÑÈåÀà, úÌÄäÀéÆä úÀîåÌøÈúåÉ.
31.english: Let him not trust in vanity, deceiving himself; for vanity shall be his recompense.

32.english: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be leafy.

33.hebrew: éÇçÀîÉñ ëÌÇâÌÆôÆï áÌÄñÀøåÉ;    åÀéÇùÑÀìÅêÀ ëÌÇæÌÇéÄú, ğÄöÌÈúåÉ.
33.english: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.

34.hebrew: ëÌÄé-òÂãÇú çÈğÅó âÌÇìÀîåÌã;    åÀàÅùÑ, àÈëÀìÈä àÈäÃìÅé-ùÑÉçÇã.
34.english: For the company of the godless shall be desolate, and fire shall consume the tents of bribery.

35.hebrew: äÈøÉä òÈîÈì, åÀéÈìÉã àÈåÆï;    åÌáÄèÀğÈí, úÌÈëÄéï îÄøÀîÈä.
35.english: They conceive mischief, and bring forth iniquity, and their belly prepareth deceit.

1.english: {S} Then Job answered and said:

2.hebrew: שָׁמַעְתִּי כְאֵלֶּה רַבּוֹת;    מְנַחֲמֵי עָמָל כֻּלְּכֶם.
2.english: I have heard many such things; sorry comforters are ye all.

3.hebrew: הֲקֵץ לְדִבְרֵי-רוּחַ;    אוֹ מַה-יַּמְרִיצְךָ, כִּי תַעֲנֶה.
3.english: Shall windy words have an end? Or what provoketh thee that thou answerest?

4.hebrew: גַּם, אָנֹכִי--    כָּכֶם אֲדַבֵּרָה:לוּ יֵשׁ נַפְשְׁכֶם, תַּחַת נַפְשִׁי--    אַחְבִּירָה עֲלֵיכֶם בְּמִלִּים;וְאָנִיעָה עֲלֵיכֶם,    בְּמוֹ רֹאשִׁי.
4.english: I also could speak as ye do; {N}if your soul were in my soul's stead, I could join words together against you, {N}and shake my head at you.

5.hebrew: אֲאַמִּצְכֶם בְּמוֹ-פִי;    וְנִיד שְׂפָתַי יַחְשֹׂךְ.
5.english: I would strengthen you with my mouth, and the moving of my lips would assuage your grief.

6.hebrew: אִם-אֲדַבְּרָה, לֹא-יֵחָשֵׂךְ כְּאֵבִי;    וְאַחְדְּלָה, מַה-מִּנִּי יַהֲלֹךְ.
6.english: Though I speak, my pain is not assuaged; and though I forbear, what am I eased?

7.hebrew: אַךְ-עַתָּה הֶלְאָנִי;    הֲשִׁמּוֹתָ, כָּל-עֲדָתִי.
7.english: But now He hath made me weary; Thou hast made desolate all my company.

8.hebrew: וַתִּקְמְטֵנִי, לְעֵד הָיָה;    וַיָּקָם בִּי כַחֲשִׁי, בְּפָנַי יַעֲנֶה.
8.english: And Thou hast shrivelled me up, which is a witness against me; and my leanness riseth up against me, it testifieth to my face.

9.hebrew: אַפּוֹ טָרַף, וַיִּשְׂטְמֵנִי--חָרַק עָלַי בְּשִׁנָּיו;    צָרִי, יִלְטֹשׁ עֵינָיו לִי.
9.english: He hath torn me in His wrath, and hated me; He hath gnashed upon me with His teeth; mine adversary sharpeneth his eyes upon me.

10.hebrew: פָּעֲרוּ עָלַי, בְּפִיהֶם--בְּחֶרְפָּה, הִכּוּ לְחָיָי;    יַחַד, עָלַי יִתְמַלָּאוּן.
10.english: They have gaped upon me with their mouth; they have smitten me upon the cheek scornfully; they gather themselves together against me.

11.hebrew: יַסְגִּירֵנִי אֵל, אֶל עֲוִיל;    וְעַל-יְדֵי רְשָׁעִים יִרְטֵנִי.
11.english: God delivereth me to the ungodly, and casteth me into the hands of the wicked.

12.hebrew: שָׁלֵו הָיִיתִי, וַיְפַרְפְּרֵנִי--    וְאָחַז בְּעָרְפִּי, וַיְפַצְפְּצֵנִי;וַיְקִימֵנִי לוֹ,    לְמַטָּרָה.
12.english: I was at ease, and He broke me asunder; yea, He hath taken me by the neck, and dashed me to pieces; {N}He hath also set me up for His mark.

13.hebrew: יָסֹבּוּ עָלַי, רַבָּיו--    יְפַלַּח כִּלְיוֹתַי, וְלֹא יַחְמֹל;יִשְׁפֹּךְ לָאָרֶץ,    מְרֵרָתִי.
13.english: His archers compass me round about, He cleaveth my reins asunder, and doth not spare; {N}He poureth out my gall upon the ground.

14.hebrew: יִפְרְצֵנִי פֶרֶץ, עַל-פְּנֵי-פָרֶץ;    יָרֻץ עָלַי כְּגִבּוֹר.
14.english: He breaketh me with breach upon breach; He runneth upon me like a giant.

15.hebrew: שַׂק תָּפַרְתִּי, עֲלֵי גִלְדִּי;    וְעֹלַלְתִּי בֶעָפָר קַרְנִי.
15.english: I have sewed sackcloth upon my skin, and have laid my horn in the dust.

16.hebrew: פָּנַי חמרמרה (חֳמַרְמְרוּ), מִנִּי-בֶכִי;    וְעַל עַפְעַפַּי צַלְמָוֶת.
16.english: My face is reddened with weeping, and on my eyelids is the shadow of death;

17.hebrew: עַל, לֹא-חָמָס בְּכַפָּי;    וּתְפִלָּתִי זַכָּה.
17.english: Although there is no violence in my hands, and my prayer is pure.

18.hebrew: אֶרֶץ, אַל-תְּכַסִּי דָמִי;    וְאַל-יְהִי מָקוֹם, לְזַעֲקָתִי.
18.english: O earth, cover not thou my blood, and let my cry have no resting-place.

19.hebrew: גַּם-עַתָּה, הִנֵּה-בַשָּׁמַיִם עֵדִי;    וְשָׂהֲדִי, בַּמְּרֹמִים.
19.english: Even now, behold, my Witness is in heaven, and He that testifieth of me is on high.

20.hebrew: מְלִיצַי רֵעָי;    אֶל-אֱלוֹהַּ, דָּלְפָה עֵינִי.
20.english: Mine inward thoughts are my intercessors, mine eye poureth out tears unto God;

21.hebrew: וְיוֹכַח לְגֶבֶר עִם-אֱלוֹהַּ;    וּבֶן-אָדָם לְרֵעֵהוּ.
21.english: That He would set aright a man contending with God, as a son of man setteth aright his neighbour!

22.hebrew: כִּי-שְׁנוֹת מִסְפָּר יֶאֱתָיוּ;    וְאֹרַח לֹא-אָשׁוּב אֶהֱלֹךְ.
22.english: For the years that are few are coming on, and I shall go the way whence I shall not return.

1.hebrew: רוּחִי חֻבָּלָה, יָמַי נִזְעָכוּ;    קְבָרִים לִי.
1.english: My spirit is consumed, my days are extinct, the grave is ready for me.

2.hebrew: אִם-לֹא הֲתֻלִים, עִמָּדִי;    וּבְהַמְּרוֹתָם, תָּלַן עֵינִי.
2.english: Surely there are mockers with me, and mine eye abideth in their provocation.

3.hebrew: שִׂימָה-נָּא, עָרְבֵנִי עִמָּךְ;    מִי הוּא, לְיָדִי יִתָּקֵעַ.
3.english: Give now a pledge, be surety for me with Thyself; who else is there that will strike hands with me?

4.hebrew: כִּי-לִבָּם, צָפַנְתָּ מִּשָּׂכֶל;    עַל-כֵּן, לֹא תְרֹמֵם.
4.english: For Thou hast hid their heart from understanding; therefore shalt Thou not exalt them.

5.hebrew: לְחֵלֶק, יַגִּיד רֵעִים;    וְעֵינֵי בָנָיו תִּכְלֶנָה.
5.english: He that denounceth his friends for the sake of flattery, even the eyes of his children shall fail.

6.hebrew: וְהִצִּיגַנִי, לִמְשֹׁל עַמִּים;    וְתֹפֶת לְפָנִים אֶהְיֶה.
6.english: He hath made me also a byword of the people; and I am become one in whose face they spit.

7.hebrew: וַתֵּכַהּ מִכַּעַשׂ עֵינִי;    וִיצֻרַי כַּצֵּל כֻּלָּם.
7.english: Mine eye also is dimmed by reason of vexation, and all my members are as a shadow.

8.hebrew: יָשֹׁמּוּ יְשָׁרִים עַל-זֹאת;    וְנָקִי, עַל-חָנֵף יִתְעֹרָר.
8.english: Upright men are astonished at this, and the innocent stirreth up himself against the godless.

9.hebrew: וְיֹאחֵז צַדִּיק דַּרְכּוֹ;    וּטְהָר-יָדַיִם, יֹסִיף אֹמֶץ.
9.english: Yet the righteous holdeth on his way, and he that hath clean hands waxeth stronger and stronger.

10.hebrew: וְאוּלָם--כֻּלָּם תָּשֻׁבוּ, וּבֹאוּ נָא;    וְלֹא-אֶמְצָא בָכֶם חָכָם.
10.english: But as for you all, do ye return, and come now; and I shall not find a wise man among you.

11.hebrew: יָמַי עָבְרוּ, זִמֹּתַי נִתְּקוּ--    מוֹרָשֵׁי לְבָבִי.
11.english: My days are past, my purposes are broken off, even the thoughts of my heart.

12.hebrew: לַיְלָה, לְיוֹם יָשִׂימוּ;    אוֹר, קָרוֹב מִפְּנֵי-חֹשֶׁךְ.
12.english: They change the night into day; the light is short because of darkness.

13.hebrew: אִם-אֲקַוֶּה, שְׁאוֹל בֵּיתִי;    בַּחֹשֶׁךְ, רִפַּדְתִּי יְצוּעָי.
13.english: If I look for the nether-world as my house; if I have spread my couch in the darkness;

14.hebrew: לַשַּׁחַת קָרָאתִי, אָבִי אָתָּה;    אִמִּי וַאֲחֹתִי, לָרִמָּה.
14.english: If I have said to corruption: 'Thou art my father', to the worm: 'Thou art my mother, and my sister';

15.hebrew: וְאַיֵּה, אֵפוֹ תִקְוָתִי;    וְתִקְוָתִי, מִי יְשׁוּרֶנָּה.
15.english: Where then is my hope? And as for my hope, who shall see it?

16.hebrew: בַּדֵּי שְׁאֹל תֵּרַדְנָה;    אִם-יַחַד עַל-עָפָר נָחַת.
16.english: They shall go down to the bars of the nether-world, when we are at rest together in the dust.

1.english: {S} Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said:

2.hebrew: עַד-אָנָה, תְּשִׂימוּן קִנְצֵי לְמִלִּין;    תָּבִינוּ, וְאַחַר נְדַבֵּר.
2.english: How long will ye lay snares for words? Consider, and afterwards we will speak.

3.hebrew: מַדּוּעַ, נֶחְשַׁבְנוּ כַבְּהֵמָה;    נִטְמִינוּ, בְּעֵינֵיכֶם.
3.english: Wherefore are we counted as beasts, and reputed dull in your sight?

4.hebrew: טֹרֵף נַפְשׁוֹ, בְּאַפּוֹ:    הַלְמַעַנְךָ, תֵּעָזַב אָרֶץ; וְיֶעְתַּק-צוּר, מִמְּקֹמוֹ.
4.english: Thou that tearest thyself in thine anger, shall the earth be forsaken for thee? Or shall the rock be removed out of its place?

5.hebrew: גַּם אוֹר רְשָׁעִים יִדְעָךְ;    וְלֹא-יִגַּהּ, שְׁבִיב אִשּׁוֹ.
5.english: Yea, the light of the wicked shall be put out, and the spark of his fire shall not shine.

6.hebrew: אוֹר, חָשַׁךְ בְּאָהֳלוֹ;    וְנֵרוֹ, עָלָיו יִדְעָךְ.
6.english: The light shall be dark in his tent, and his lamp over him shall be put out.

7.hebrew: יֵצְרוּ, צַעֲדֵי אוֹנוֹ;    וְתַשְׁלִיכֵהוּ עֲצָתוֹ.
7.english: The steps of his strength shall be straitened, and his own counsel shall cast him down.

8.hebrew: כִּי-שֻׁלַּח בְּרֶשֶׁת בְּרַגְלָיו;    וְעַל-שְׂבָכָה, יִתְהַלָּךְ.
8.english: For he is cast into a net by his own feet, and he walketh upon the toils.

9.hebrew: יֹאחֵז בְּעָקֵב פָּח;    יַחֲזֵק עָלָיו צַמִּים.
9.english: A gin shall take him by the heel, and a snare shall lay hold on him.

10.hebrew: טָמוּן בָּאָרֶץ חַבְלוֹ;    וּמַלְכֻּדְתּוֹ, עֲלֵי נָתִיב.
10.english: A noose is hid for him in the ground, and a trap for him in the way.

11.hebrew: סָבִיב, בִּעֲתֻהוּ בַלָּהוֹת;    וֶהֱפִיצֻהוּ לְרַגְלָיו.
11.english: Terrors shall overwhelm him on every side, and shall entrap him at his feet.

12.hebrew: יְהִי-רָעֵב אֹנוֹ;    וְאֵיד, נָכוֹן לְצַלְעוֹ.
12.english: His trouble shall be ravenous, and calamity shall be ready for his fall.

13.hebrew: יֹאכַל, בַּדֵּי עוֹרוֹ;    יֹאכַל בַּדָּיו, בְּכוֹר מָוֶת.
13.english: It shall devour the members of his body, yea, the first-born of death shall devour his members.

14.hebrew: יִנָּתֵק מֵאָהֳלוֹ, מִבְטַחוֹ;    וְתַצְעִדֵהוּ, לְמֶלֶךְ בַּלָּהוֹת.
14.english: That wherein he trusteth shall be plucked out of his tent; and he shall be brought to the king of terrors.

15.hebrew: תִּשְׁכּוֹן בְּאָהֳלוֹ, מִבְּלִילוֹ;    יְזֹרֶה עַל-נָוֵהוּ גָפְרִית.
15.english: There shall dwell in his tent that which is none of his; brimstone shall be scattered upon his habitation.

16.hebrew: מִתַּחַת, שָׁרָשָׁיו יִבָשׁוּ;    וּמִמַּעַל, יִמַּל קְצִירוֹ.
16.english: His roots shall dry up beneath, and above shall his branch wither.

17.hebrew: זִכְרוֹ-אָבַד, מִנִּי-אָרֶץ;    וְלֹא-שֵׁם לוֹ, עַל-פְּנֵי-חוּץ.
17.english: His remembrance shall perish from the earth, and he shall have no name abroad.

18.hebrew: יֶהְדְּפֻהוּ, מֵאוֹר אֶל-חֹשֶׁךְ;    וּמִתֵּבֵל יְנִדֻּהוּ.
18.english: He shall be driven from light into darkness, and chased out of the world.

19.hebrew: לֹא נִין לוֹ וְלֹא-נֶכֶד בְּעַמּוֹ;    וְאֵין שָׂרִיד, בִּמְגוּרָיו.
19.english: He shall have neither son nor son's son among his people, nor any remaining in his dwellings.

20.hebrew: עַל-יוֹמוֹ, נָשַׁמּוּ אַחֲרֹנִים;    וְקַדְמֹנִים, אָחֲזוּ שָׂעַר.
20.english: They that come after shall be astonished at his day, as they that went before are affrighted.

21.hebrew: אַךְ-אֵלֶּה, מִשְׁכְּנוֹת עַוָּל;    וְזֶה, מְקוֹם לֹא-יָדַע-אֵל.
21.english: Surely such are the dwellings of the wicked, and this is the place of him that knoweth not God.

1.english: {S} Then Job answered and said:

2.hebrew: ††т«г-а»р»д, ъће…вјйећп р«фјщ—ƒй; †† ећъјг«лћаећр«рƒй бјоƒмћƒйн.
2.english: How long will ye vex my soul, and crush me with words?

3.hebrew: ††ж∆д т∆щ“∆ш фћјт»оƒйн, ъћ«лјмƒйоећрƒй; †† м…а-ъ≈б…щ—ећ, ъћ«дјлћјшећ-мƒй.
3.english: These ten times have ye reproached me; ye are not ashamed that ye deal harshly with me.

4.hebrew: ††еја«у-а»ојр»н щ—»вƒйъƒй; †† аƒъћƒй, ъћ»мƒйп ојщ—ећв»ъƒй.
4.english: And be it indeed that I have erred, mine error remaineth with myself.

5.hebrew: ††аƒн-а»ојр»н, т»м«й ъћ«вјгћƒймећ; †† ејъе…лƒйзећ т»м«й, з∆шјфћ»ъƒй.
5.english: If indeed ye will magnify yourselves against me, and plead against me my reproach;

6.hebrew: ††гћјтећ-а≈фе…, лћƒй-аЅме…дћ« тƒећјъ»рƒй; †† ећојцећге…, т»м«й дƒчћƒйу.
6.english: Know now that God hath subverted my cause, and hath compassed me with His net.

7.hebrew: ††д≈п а∆цјт«ч з»о»с, ејм…а а≈т»р∆д; †† а¬щ—«ећ«т, еја≈йп оƒщ—јфћ»и.
7.english: Behold, I cry out: 'Violence!' but I am not heard; I cry aloud, but there is no justice.

8.hebrew: ††а»шјзƒй в»г«ш, ејм…а а∆тЅбе…ш; †† ејт«м рјъƒйбе…ъ«й, з…щ—∆кј й»щ“ƒйн.
8.english: He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and hath set darkness in my paths.

9.hebrew: ††лћјбе…гƒй, о≈т»м«й дƒфјщ—ƒйи; †† е«йћ»с«ш, т¬и∆ш∆ъ ш…ащ—ƒй.
9.english: He hath stripped me of my glory, and taken the crown from my head.

10.hebrew: ††йƒъћјц≈рƒй с»бƒйб, е»а≈м«кј; †† е«йћ«сћ«т лћ»т≈х, ъћƒчје»ъƒй.
10.english: He hath broken me down on every side, and I am gone; and my hope hath He plucked up like a tree.

11.hebrew: ††е«йћ«з«ш т»м«й а«фће…; †† е«йћ«зјщ—јб≈рƒй ме… лјц»ш»йе.
11.english: He hath also kindled His wrath against me, and He counteth me unto Him as one of His adversaries.

12.hebrew: ††й«з«г, й»б…аећ вјгећг»йе--е«йћ»с…мћећ т»м«й гћ«шјлћ»н; †† е«йћ«з¬рећ с»бƒйб мја»д√мƒй.
12.english: His troops come on together, and cast up their way against me, and encamp round about my tent.

13.hebrew: ††а«з«й, о≈т»м«й дƒшјзƒйч; †† ејй…гјт«й, а«кј-ж»шећ оƒоћ∆рћƒй.
13.english: He hath put my brethren far from me, and mine acquaintance are wholly estranged from me.

14.hebrew: ††з»гјмећ чјше…б»й; †† ећојйЋгћ»т«й щ—јл≈зећрƒй.
14.english: My kinsfolk have failed, and my familiar friends have forgotten me.

15.hebrew: ††вћ»ш≈й б≈йъƒй еја«ојд…ъ«й, мјж»ш ъћ«зјщ—јбЋрƒй; †† р»лјшƒй, д»йƒйъƒй бјт≈йр≈йд∆н.
15.english: They that dwell in my house, and my maids, count me for a stranger; I am become an alien in their sight.

16.hebrew: ††мјт«бјгћƒй ч»ш»аъƒй, ејм…а й«т¬р∆д; †† бћјое…-фƒй, а∆ъјз«рћ∆п-ме….
16.english: I call unto my servant, and he giveth me no answer, though I entreat him with my mouth.

17.hebrew: ††шећзƒй, ж»ш»д мјаƒщ—јъћƒй; †† ејз«рћ…ъƒй, мƒбјр≈й бƒијрƒй.
17.english: My breath is abhorred of my wife, and I am loathsome to the children of my tribe.

18.hebrew: ††вћ«н-т¬еƒймƒйн, о»а¬сећ бƒй; †† а»чећо»д, е«йјг«бћјшећ-бƒй.
18.english: Even urchins despised me; if I arise, they speak against me.

19.hebrew: ††ъћƒт¬бећрƒй, лћ»м-ојъ≈й се…гƒй; †† ејж∆д-а»д«бјъћƒй, р∆дјфћјлећ-бƒй.
19.english: All my intimate friends abhor me; and they whom I loved are turned against me.

20.hebrew: ††бћјте…шƒй ећбƒбјщ“»шƒй, гћ»бјч»д т«цјоƒй; †† е»а∆ъјо«мћји»д, бћјте…ш щ—ƒрћ»й.
20.english: My bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh, and I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.

21.hebrew: ††з»рћЋрƒй з»рћЋрƒй а«ъћ∆н ш≈т»й: †† лћƒй й«г-аЅме…дћ«, р»вјт»д бћƒй.
21.english: Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, O ye my friends; for the hand of God hath touched me.

22.hebrew: ††м»оћ»д, ъћƒшјгћјфЋрƒй лјое…-а≈м; †† ећоƒбћјщ“»шƒй, м…а ъƒщ“јбћ»тећ.
22.english: Why do ye persecute me as God, and are not satisfied with my flesh?

23.hebrew: ††оƒй-йƒъћ≈п а≈фе…, ејйƒлћ»ъјбећп оƒмћ»й: †† оƒй-йƒъћ≈п бћ«сћ≈ф∆ш ејйЋз»чећ.
23.english: Oh that my words were now written! Oh that they were inscribed in a book!

24.hebrew: ††бћјт≈и-бћ«шјж∆м ејт…ф»ш∆ъ-- †† м»т«г, бћ«цћећш й≈з»цјбећп.
24.english: That with an iron pen and lead they were graven in the rock for ever!

25.hebrew: ††е«а¬рƒй й»г«тјъћƒй, вћ…а¬мƒй з»й; †† еја«з¬ше…п, т«м-т»ф»ш й»чећн.
25.english: But as for me, I know that my Redeemer liveth, and that He will witness at the last upon the dust;

26.hebrew: ††еја«з«ш те…шƒй, рƒчћјфећ-ж…аъ; †† ећоƒбћјщ“»шƒй, а∆зЅж∆д аЅме…дћ«.
26.english: And when after my skin this is destroyed, then without my flesh shall I see God;

27.hebrew: ††а¬щ—∆ш а¬рƒй, а∆зЅж∆д-мћƒй--ејт≈йр«й ш»аећ ејм…а-ж»ш: †† лћ»мећ лƒмјй…ъ«й бћјз≈чƒй.
27.english: Whom I, even I, shall see for myself, and mine eyes shall behold, and not another's. My reins are consumed within me.

28.english: If ye say: 'How we will persecute him!' seeing that the root of the matter is found in me;

29.hebrew: ††вћећшећ м»л∆н, оƒфћјр≈й-з∆ш∆б--лћƒй-з≈о»д, т¬е ре…ъ з»ш∆б: †† мјо«т«п ъћ≈гјтећп щгйп (щ—«гћећп).
29.english: Be ye afraid of the sword; for wrath bringeth the punishments of the sword, that ye may know there is a judgment.

1.english: {S} Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said:

2.hebrew: ††м»л≈п, щ“јтƒфћ«й йјщ—ƒйбећрƒй; †† ећб«т¬бећш, зећщ—ƒй бƒй.
2.english: Therefore do my thoughts give answer to me, even by reason of mine agitation that is in me.

3.hebrew: ††оећс«ш лћјмƒоћ»ъƒй а∆щ—јо»т; †† ејшећз«, оƒбћƒйр»ъƒй й«т¬р≈рƒй.
3.english: I have heard the reproof which putteth me to shame, but out of my understanding my spirit answereth me.

4.hebrew: ††д¬ж…аъ й»г«тјъћ», оƒрћƒй-т«г; †† оƒрћƒй щ“ƒйн а»г»н т¬м≈й-а»ш∆х.
4.english: Knowest thou not this of old time, since man was placed upon earth,

5.hebrew: ††лћƒй шƒрјр«ъ шјщ—»тƒйн, оƒчћ»ше…б; †† ејщ“ƒојз«ъ з»р≈у т¬г≈й-ш»в«т.
5.english: That the triumphing of the wicked is short, and the joy of the godless but for a moment?

6.hebrew: ††аƒн-й«т¬м∆д м«щћ—»о«йƒн щ“ƒйае…; †† ејш…ащ—е…, м»т»б й«вћƒйт«.
6.english: Though his excellency mount up to the heavens, and his head reach unto the clouds;

7.hebrew: ††лћјв∆мјме…, м»р∆ц«з й…аб≈г; †† ш…а»йе, й…аојшећ а«йће….
7.english: Yet he shall perish for ever like his own dung; they that have seen him shall say: 'Where is he?'

8.hebrew: ††лћ«з¬ме…н й»тећу, ејм…а йƒојц»аЋдећ; †† ејйЋгћ«г, лћјз∆жјйе…п м»йјм»д.
8.english: He shall fly away as a dream, and shall not be found; yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night.

9.hebrew: ††т«йƒп щ—јж»ф«ъћећ, ејм…а ъе…сƒйу; †† ејм…а-те…г, ъћјщ—ећш∆рћећ ојче…ое….
9.english: The eye which saw him shall see him no more; neither shall his place any more behold him.

10.hebrew: ††бћ»р»йе, йјш«цћећ г«мћƒйн; †† ејй»г»йе, ъћ»щ—≈бјр»д ае…ре….
10.english: His children shall appease the poor, and his hands shall restore his wealth.

11.hebrew: ††т«цјое…ъ»йе, о»мјаећ т¬мећо»е; †† ејтƒоће…, т«м-т»ф»ш ъћƒщ—јлћ»б.
11.english: His bones are full of his youth, but it shall lie down with him in the dust.

12.hebrew: ††аƒн-ъћ«ојъћƒйч бћјфƒйе ш»т»д-- †† й«лјзƒйг∆рћ»д, ъћ«з«ъ мјщ—…ре….
12.english: Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth, though he hide it under his tongue;

13.hebrew: ††й«зјо…м т»м∆йд», ејм…а й«т«жјб∆рћ»д; †† ејйƒојр»т∆рћ»д, бћјъе…кј зƒлће….
13.english: Though he spare it, and will not let it go, but keep it still within his mouth;

14.hebrew: ††м«зјое…, бћјо≈т»йе р∆дјфћ»кј; †† ојше…ш«ъ фћјъ»рƒйн бћјчƒшјбће….
14.english: Yet his food in his bowels is turned, it is the gall of asps within him.

15.hebrew: ††з«йƒм бћ»м«т, е«йјчƒа∆рћећ; †† оƒбћƒијре…, й…шƒщ—∆рћећ а≈м.
15.english: He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again; God shall cast them out of his belly.

16.hebrew: ††ш…ащ—-фћјъ»рƒйн йƒйр»ч; †† ъћ«д«шјв≈дећ, мјщ—е…п а∆фјт∆д.
16.english: He shall suck the poison of asps; the viper's tongue shall slay him.

17.hebrew: ††а«м-й≈ш∆а бƒфјм«вће…ъ-- †† р«д¬ш≈й р«з¬м≈й, гћјб«щ— ејз∆оја»д.
17.english: He shall not look upon the rivers, the flowing streams of honey and curd.

18.hebrew: ††о≈щ—ƒйб й»в»т, ејм…а йƒбјм»т; †† лћјз≈йм ъћјоећш»ъе…, ејм…а й«т¬м…с.
18.english: That which he laboured for shall he give back, and shall not swallow it down; according to the substance that he hath gotten, he shall not rejoice.

19.hebrew: ††лћƒй-шƒцћ«х, т»ж«б гћ«мћƒйн; †† бћ«йƒъ вћ»ж«м, ејм…а йƒбјр≈дећ.
19.english: For he hath oppressed and forsaken the poor; he hath violently taken away a house, and he shall not build it up.

20.hebrew: ††лћƒй, м…а-й»г«т щ—»м≈е бћјбƒијре…; †† бћ«з¬оећге…, м…а йјо«мћ≈и.
20.english: Because he knew no quietness within him, in his greed he suffered nought to escape,

21.hebrew: ††а≈йп-щ“»шƒйг мја»лјме…; †† т«м-лћ≈п, м…а-й»зƒйм иећбе….
21.english: There was nothing left that he devoured not--therefore his prosperity shall not endure.

22.hebrew: ††бћƒојм…аеъ щ“ƒфјче…, й≈ц∆ш ме…; †† лћ»м-й«г т»о≈м ъћјб…а∆рћећ.
22.english: In the fulness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits; the hand of every one that is in misery shall come upon him.

23.hebrew: ††йјдƒй, мјо«мћ≈а бƒијре…--йјщ—«мћ«з-бће…, з¬ше…п а«фће…; †† ејй«оји≈ш т»м≈йое…, бћƒмјзећое….
23.english: It shall be for the filling of his belly; He shall cast the fierceness of His wrath upon him, and shall cause it to rain upon him into his flesh.

24.hebrew: ††йƒбјш«з, оƒрћ≈щ—∆ч бћ«шјж∆м; †† ъћ«зјмјф≈дећ, ч∆щ—∆ъ рјзећщ—»д.
24.english: If he flee from the iron weapon, the bow of brass shall strike him through.

25.hebrew: ††щ—»м«у, е«йћ≈ц≈а оƒвћ≈е»д: †† ећб»ш»ч, оƒоћјш…ш»ъе… й«д¬м…кј; т»м»йе а≈оƒйн.
25.english: He draweth it forth, and it cometh out of his body; yea, the glittering point cometh out of his gall; terrors are upon him.

26.hebrew: ††лћ»м-з…щ—∆кј, †† и»оећп мƒцјфћећр»йе:ъћја»лјм≈дећ, а≈щ— м…а-рЋфћ»з; †† й≈ш«т щ“»шƒйг бћја»д√ме….
26.english: All darkness is laid up for his treasures; {N}a fire not blown by man shall consume him; it shall go ill with him that is left in his tent.

27.hebrew: ††йјв«мћећ щ—»о«йƒн т¬е ре…; †† еја∆ш∆х, оƒъјче…о»о»д ме….
27.english: The heavens shall reveal his iniquity, and the earth shall rise up against him.

28.english: The increase of his house shall depart, his goods shall flow away in the day of his wrath.

29.english: This is the portion of a wicked man from God, and the heritage appointed unto him by God.

1.english: {S} Then Job answered and said:

2.hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ שָׁמוֹעַ, מִלָּתִי;    וּתְהִי-זֹאת, תַּנְחוּמֹתֵיכֶם.
2.english: Hear diligently my speech; and let this be your consolations.

3.hebrew: שָׂאוּנִי, וְאָנֹכִי אֲדַבֵּר;    וְאַחַר דַּבְּרִי תַלְעִיג.
3.english: Suffer me, that I may speak; and after that I have spoken, mock on.

4.hebrew: הֶאָנֹכִי, לְאָדָם שִׂיחִי;    וְאִם-מַדּוּעַ, לֹא-תִקְצַר רוּחִי.
4.english: As for me, is my complaint to man? Or why should I not be impatient?

5.hebrew: פְּנוּ-אֵלַי וְהָשַׁמּוּ;    וְשִׂימוּ יָד עַל-פֶּה.
5.english: Turn unto me, and be astonished, and lay your hand upon your mouth.

6.hebrew: וְאִם-זָכַרְתִּי וְנִבְהָלְתִּי;    וְאָחַז בְּשָׂרִי, פַּלָּצוּת.
6.english: Even when I remember I am affrighted, and horror hath taketh hold on my flesh.

7.hebrew: מַדּוּעַ, רְשָׁעִים יִחְיוּ;    עָתְקוּ, גַּם-גָּבְרוּ חָיִל.
7.english: Wherefore do the wicked live, become old, yea, wax mighty in power?

8.hebrew: זַרְעָם נָכוֹן לִפְנֵיהֶם עִמָּם;    וְצֶאֱצָאֵיהֶם, לְעֵינֵיהֶם.
8.english: Their seed is established in their sight with them, and their offspring before their eyes.

9.hebrew: בָּתֵּיהֶם שָׁלוֹם מִפָּחַד;    וְלֹא שֵׁבֶט אֱלוֹהַּ עֲלֵיהֶם.
9.english: Their houses are safe, without fear, neither is the rod of God upon them.

10.hebrew: שׁוֹרוֹ עִבַּר, וְלֹא יַגְעִל;    תְּפַלֵּט פָּרָתוֹ, וְלֹא תְשַׁכֵּל.
10.english: Their bull gendereth, and faileth not; their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.

11.hebrew: יְשַׁלְּחוּ כַצֹּאן, עֲוִילֵיהֶם;    וְיַלְדֵיהֶם, יְרַקֵּדוּן.
11.english: They send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance.

12.hebrew: יִשְׂאוּ, כְּתֹף וְכִנּוֹר;    וְיִשְׂמְחוּ, לְקוֹל עוּגָב.
12.english: They sing to the timbrel and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the pipe.

13.hebrew: יבלו (יְכַלּוּ) בַטּוֹב יְמֵיהֶם;    וּבְרֶגַע, שְׁאוֹל יֵחָתּוּ.
13.english: They spend their days in prosperity, and peacefully they go down to the grave.

14.hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ לָאֵל, סוּר מִמֶּנּוּ;    וְדַעַת דְּרָכֶיךָ, לֹא חָפָצְנוּ.
14.english: Yet they said unto God: 'Depart from us; for we desire not the knowledge of Thy ways.

15.hebrew: מַה-שַּׁדַּי כִּי-נַעַבְדֶנּוּ;    וּמַה-נּוֹעִיל, כִּי נִפְגַּע-בּוֹ.
15.english: What is the Almighty, that we should serve Him? And what profit should we have, if we pray unto Him?'--

16.hebrew: הֵן לֹא בְיָדָם טוּבָם;    עֲצַת רְשָׁעִים, רָחֲקָה מֶנִּי.
16.english: Lo, their prosperity is not in their hand; the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

17.hebrew: כַּמָּה, נֵר-רְשָׁעִים יִדְעָךְ--    וְיָבֹא עָלֵימוֹ אֵידָם;חֲבָלִים,    יְחַלֵּק בְּאַפּוֹ.
17.english: How oft is it that the lamp of the wicked is put out? that their calamity cometh upon them? {N}that He distributeth pains in His anger?

18.hebrew: יִהְיוּ, כְּתֶבֶן לִפְנֵי-רוּחַ;    וּכְמֹץ, גְּנָבַתּוּ סוּפָה.
18.english: That they are as stubble before the wind, and as chaff that the storm stealeth away?

19.hebrew: אֱלוֹהַּ, יִצְפֹּן-לְבָנָיו אוֹנוֹ;    יְשַׁלֵּם אֵלָיו וְיֵדָע.
19.english: 'God layeth up his iniquity for his children!'--let Him recompense it unto himself, that he may know it.

20.hebrew: יִרְאוּ עֵינָו כִּידוֹ;    וּמֵחֲמַת שַׁדַּי יִשְׁתֶּה.
20.english: Let his own eyes see his destruction, and let him drink of the wrath of the Almighty.

21.hebrew: כִּי מַה-חֶפְצוֹ בְּבֵיתוֹ אַחֲרָיו;    וּמִסְפַּר חֳדָשָׁיו חֻצָּצוּ.
21.english: For what pleasure hath he in his house after him? seeing the number of his months is determined.

22.hebrew: הַלְאֵל יְלַמֶּד-דָּעַת;    וְהוּא, רָמִים יִשְׁפּוֹט.
22.english: Shall any teach God knowledge? seeing it is He that judgeth those that are high.

23.hebrew: זֶה--יָמוּת, בְּעֶצֶם תֻּמּוֹ;    כֻּלּוֹ, שַׁלְאֲנַן וְשָׁלֵיו.
23.english: One dieth in his full strength, being wholly at ease and quiet;

24.hebrew: עֲטִינָיו, מָלְאוּ חָלָב;    וּמֹחַ עַצְמוֹתָיו יְשֻׁקֶּה.
24.english: His pails are full of milk, and the marrow of his bones is moistened.

25.hebrew: וְזֶה--יָמוּת, בְּנֶפֶשׁ מָרָה;    וְלֹא-אָכַל, בַּטּוֹבָה.
25.english: And another dieth in bitterness of soul, and hath never tasted of good.

26.hebrew: יַחַד, עַל-עָפָר יִשְׁכָּבוּ;    וְרִמָּה, תְּכַסֶּה עֲלֵיהֶם.
26.english: They lie down alike in the dust, and the worm covereth them.

27.hebrew: הֵן יָדַעְתִּי, מַחְשְׁבוֹתֵיכֶם;    וּמְזִמּוֹת, עָלַי תַּחְמֹסוּ.
27.english: Behold, I know your thoughts, and the devices which ye wrongfully imagine against me.

28.hebrew: כִּי תֹאמְרוּ, אַיֵּה בֵית-נָדִיב;    וְאַיֵּה, אֹהֶל מִשְׁכְּנוֹת רְשָׁעִים.
28.english: For ye say: 'Where is the house of the prince? And where is the tent wherein the wicked dwelt?'

29.hebrew: הֲלֹא שְׁאֶלְתֶּם, עוֹבְרֵי דָרֶךְ;    וְאֹתֹתָם, לֹא תְנַכֵּרוּ.
29.english: Have ye not asked them that go by the way; and will ye misdeem their tokens,

30.hebrew: כִּי לְיוֹם אֵיד, יֵחָשֶׂךְ רָע;    לְיוֹם עֲבָרוֹת יוּבָלוּ.
30.english: That the evil man is reserved to the day of calamity, that they are led forth to the day of wrath?

31.hebrew: מִי-יַגִּיד עַל-פָּנָיו דַּרְכּוֹ;    וְהוּא-עָשָׂה, מִי יְשַׁלֶּם-לוֹ.
31.english: But who shall declare his way to his face? And who shall repay him what he hath done?

32.english: For he is borne to the grave, and watch is kept over his tomb.

33.hebrew: מָתְקוּ-לוֹ, רִגְבֵי-נָחַל:    וְאַחֲרָיו, כָּל-אָדָם יִמְשׁוֹךְ; וּלְפָנָיו, אֵין מִסְפָּר.
33.english: The clods of the valley are sweet unto him, and all men draw after him, as there were innumerable before him.

34.english: How then comfort ye me in vain? And as for your answers, there remaineth only faithlessness?

1.english: {S} Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said:

2.hebrew: ††д«мја≈м йƒсјлћ»п-вћ»б∆ш-- †† лћƒй-йƒсјлћ…п т»м≈йое… о«щ“јлћƒйм.
2.english: Can a man be profitable unto God? Or can he that is wise be profitable unto Him?

3.hebrew: ††д«з≈ф∆х мјщ—«гћ«й, лћƒй ъƒцјгћ»ч; †† ејаƒн-бћ∆ц«т, лћƒй-ъ«ъћ≈н гћјш»л∆йк».
3.english: Is it any advantage to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? Or is it gain to Him, that thou makest thy ways blameless?

4.hebrew: ††д¬оƒйћƒшја»ъјк» й…лƒйз∆к»; †† й»бе…а тƒоћјк», бћ«оћƒщ—јфћ»и.
4.english: Is it for thy fear of Him that He reproveth thee, that He entereth with thee into judgment?

5.hebrew: ††д¬м…а ш»т»ъјк» ш«бћ»д; †† еја≈йп-ч≈х, м«т¬е р…ъ∆йк».
5.english: Is not thy wickedness great? And are not thine iniquities without end?

6.hebrew: ††лћƒй-ъ«зјбћ…м а«з∆йк» зƒрћ»н; †† ећбƒвјг≈й т¬шећоћƒйн ъћ«фјщ—ƒйи.
6.english: For thou hast taken pledges of thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing.

7.hebrew: ††м…а-о«йƒн, т»й≈у ъћ«щ—јч∆д; †† ећо≈ш»т≈б, ъћƒојр«т-м»з∆н.
7.english: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.

8.hebrew: ††ејаƒйщ— жјше…т«, ме… д»а»ш∆х; †† ећрјщ“ећа ф»рƒйн, й≈щ—∆б бћ»дћ.
8.english: And as a mighty man, who hath the earth, and as a man of rank, who dwelleth in it,

9.hebrew: ††а«мјо»ре…ъ, щ—ƒмћ«зјъћ» ш≈йч»н; †† ећжјш…те…ъ йјъ…оƒйн йјгЋлћ»а.
9.english: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.

10.hebrew: ††т«м-лћ≈п, сјбƒйбе…ъ∆йк» ф«зƒйн; †† еƒйб«д∆мјк», фћ«з«г фћƒъја…н.
10.english: Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden dread affrighted thee,

11.hebrew: ††ае…-з…щ—∆кј м…а-ъƒшја∆д; †† ејщ—ƒфјт«ъ-о«йƒн ъћјл«сћ∆кћ».
11.english: Or darkness, that thou canst not see, and abundance of waters cover thee.

12.hebrew: ††д¬м…а-аЅме…дћ«, вћ…б«дћ щ—»о»йƒн; †† ећшја≈д ш…ащ— лће…л»бƒйн лћƒй-ш»оћећ.
12.english: Is not God in the height of heaven? And behold the topmost of the stars, how high they are!

13.hebrew: ††еја»о«шјъћ», о«д-йћ»г«т а≈м; †† д«бјт«г т¬ш»ф∆м йƒщ—јфће…и.
13.english: And thou sayest: 'What doth God know? Can He judge through the dark cloud?

14.hebrew: ††т»бƒйн с≈ъ∆ш-ме…, ејм…а йƒшја∆д; †† ејзећв щ—»о«йƒн, йƒъјд«мћ»кј.
14.english: Thick clouds are a covering to Him, that He seeth not; and He walketh in the circuit of heaven.'

15.hebrew: ††д«а…ш«з те…м»н ъћƒщ—јое…ш-- †† а¬щ—∆ш гћ»шјлећ ојъ≈й-а»е∆п.
15.english: Wilt thou keep the old way which wicked men have trodden?

16.hebrew: ††а¬щ—∆ш-чЋоћјиећ ејм…а-т≈ъ; †† р»д»ш, йећц«ч йјсе…г»н.
16.english: Who were snatched away before their time, whose foundation was poured out as a stream;

17.hebrew: ††д»а…ојшƒйн м»а≈м, сећш оƒоћ∆рћећ; †† ећо«д-йћƒфјт«м щ—«гћ«й м»ое….
17.english: Who said unto God: 'Depart from us'; and what could the Almighty do unto them?

18.hebrew: ††ејдећа оƒмћ≈а б»ъћ≈йд∆н ие…б; †† е«т¬ц«ъ шјщ—»тƒйн, ш»з¬ч»д о∆рћƒй.
18.english: Yet He filled their houses with good things--but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

19.hebrew: ††йƒшјаећ ц«гћƒйчƒйн ејйƒщ“јо»зећ; †† ејр»чƒй, йƒмјт«в-м»ое….
19.english: The righteous saw it, and were glad, and the innocent laugh them to scorn:

20.hebrew: ††аƒн-м…а рƒлјз«г чƒйо»рећ; †† ејйƒъјш»н, а»лјм»д а≈щ—.
20.english: 'Surely their substance is cut off, and their abundance the fire hath consumed.'

21.hebrew: ††д«сјлћ∆п-р»а тƒоће… ећщ—јм»н; †† бћ»д∆н, ъћјбе…а«ъјк» ие…б»д.
21.english: Acquaint now thyself with Him, and be at peace; thereby shall thine increase be good.

22.hebrew: ††ч«з-р»а оƒфћƒйе ъће…ш»д; †† ејщ“ƒйн а¬о»ш»йе, бћƒмјб»б∆к».
22.english: Receive, I pray thee, instruction from His mouth, and lay up His words in thy heart.

23.hebrew: ††аƒн-ъћ»щ—ећб т«г-щ—«гћ«й, ъћƒбћ»р∆д; †† ъћ«шјзƒйч т«ејм»д, о≈а»д√м∆к».
23.english: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up--if thou put away unrighteousness far from thy tents,

24.hebrew: ††ејщ—ƒйъ-т«м-т»ф»ш бћ»ц∆ш; †† ећлјцећш рјз»мƒйн ае…фƒйш.
24.english: And lay thy treasure in the dust, and the gold of Ophir among the stones of the brooks;

25.hebrew: ††ејд»й»д щ—«гћ«й бћјц»ш∆йк»; †† ејл∆с∆у ъће…т»фе…ъ м»кј.
25.english: And the Almighty be thy treasure, and precious silver unto thee;

26.hebrew: ††лћƒй-а»ж, т«м-щ—«гћ«й ъћƒъјт«рћ»в; †† ејъƒщћ“»а а∆м-аЅме…дћ« фћ»р∆йк».
26.english: Then surely shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.

27.english: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto Him, and He will hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows;

28.english: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee, and light shall shine upon thy ways.

29.english: When they cast thee down, thou shalt say: 'There is lifting up'; for the humble person He saveth.

30.english: He delivereth him that is innocent, yea, thou shalt be delivered through the cleanness of thy hands.

1.english: {S} Then Job answered and said:

2.hebrew: גַּם-הַיּוֹם, מְרִי שִׂחִי;    יָדִי, כָּבְדָה עַל-אַנְחָתִי.
2.english: Even to-day is my complaint bitter; my hand is become heavy because of my groaning.

3.hebrew: מִי-יִתֵּן יָדַעְתִּי, וְאֶמְצָאֵהוּ;    אָבוֹא, עַד-תְּכוּנָתוֹ.
3.english: Oh that I knew where I might find Him, that I might come even to His seat!

4.hebrew: אֶעֶרְכָה לְפָנָיו מִשְׁפָּט;    וּפִי, אֲמַלֵּא תוֹכָחוֹת.
4.english: I would order my cause before Him, and fill my mouth with arguments.

5.hebrew: אֵדְעָה, מִלִּים יַעֲנֵנִי;    וְאָבִינָה, מַה-יֹּאמַר לִי.
5.english: I would know the words which He would answer me, and understand what He would say unto me.

6.hebrew: הַבְּרָב-כֹּחַ, יָרִיב עִמָּדִי;    לֹא אַךְ-הוּא, יָשִׂם בִּי.
6.english: Would He contend with me in His great power? Nay; but He would give heed unto me.

7.hebrew: שָׁם--יָשָׁר, נוֹכָח עִמּוֹ;    וַאֲפַלְּטָה לָנֶצַח, מִשֹּׁפְטִי.
7.english: There the upright might reason with Him; so should I be delivered for ever from my Judge.

8.hebrew: הֵן קֶדֶם אֶהֱלֹךְ וְאֵינֶנּוּ;    וְאָחוֹר, וְלֹא-אָבִין לוֹ.
8.english: Behold, I go forward, but He is not there, and backward, but I cannot perceive Him;

9.hebrew: שְׂמֹאול בַּעֲשֹׂתוֹ, וְלֹא-אָחַז;    יַעְטֹף יָמִין, וְלֹא אֶרְאֶה.
9.english: On the left hand, when He doth work, but I cannot behold Him, He turneth Himself to the right hand, but I cannot see Him.

10.hebrew: כִּי-יָדַע, דֶּרֶךְ עִמָּדִי;    בְּחָנַנִי, כַּזָּהָב אֵצֵא.
10.english: For He knoweth the way that I take; when He hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold.

11.hebrew: בַּאֲשֻׁרוֹ, אָחֲזָה רַגְלִי;    דַּרְכּוֹ שָׁמַרְתִּי וְלֹא-אָט.
11.english: My foot hath held fast to His steps, His way have I kept, and turned not aside.

12.hebrew: מִצְוַת שְׂפָתָיו, וְלֹא אָמִישׁ;    מֵחֻקִּי, צָפַנְתִּי אִמְרֵי-פִיו.
12.english: I have not gone back from the commandment of His lips; I have treasured up the words of His mouth more than my necessary food.

13.hebrew: וְהוּא בְאֶחָד, וּמִי יְשִׁיבֶנּוּ;    וְנַפְשׁוֹ אִוְּתָה וַיָּעַשׂ.
13.english: But He is at one with Himself, and who can turn Him? And what His soul desireth, even that He doeth.

14.hebrew: כִּי, יַשְׁלִים חֻקִּי;    וְכָהֵנָּה רַבּוֹת עִמּוֹ.
14.english: For He will perform that which is appointed for me; and many such things are with Him.

15.hebrew: עַל-כֵּן, מִפָּנָיו אֶבָּהֵל;    אֶתְבּוֹנֵן, וְאֶפְחַד מִמֶּנּוּ.
15.english: Therefore am I affrighted at His presence; when I consider, I am afraid of Him.

16.hebrew: וְאֵל, הֵרַךְ לִבִּי;    וְשַׁדַּי, הִבְהִילָנִי.
16.english: Yea, God hath made my heart faint, and the Almighty hath affrighted me;

17.hebrew: כִּי-לֹא נִצְמַתִּי, מִפְּנֵי-חֹשֶׁךְ;    וּמִפָּנַי, כִּסָּה-אֹפֶל.
17.english: Because I was not cut off before the darkness, neither did He cover the thick darkness from my face.

1.hebrew: מַדּוּעַ--מִשַּׁדַּי, לֹא-נִצְפְּנוּ עִתִּים;    וְיֹדְעָו, לֹא-חָזוּ יָמָיו.
1.english: Why are times not laid up by the Almighty? And why do not they that know Him see His days?

2.hebrew: גְּבֻלוֹת יַשִּׂיגוּ;    עֵדֶר גָּזְלוּ, וַיִּרְעוּ.
2.english: There are that remove the landmarks; they violently take away flocks, and feed them.

3.hebrew: חֲמוֹר יְתוֹמִים יִנְהָגוּ;    יַחְבְּלוּ, שׁוֹר אַלְמָנָה.
3.english: They drive away the ass of the fatherless, they take the widow's ox for a pledge.

4.hebrew: יַטּוּ אֶבְיֹנִים מִדָּרֶךְ;    יַחַד חֻבְּאוּ, עֲנִיֵּי-אָרֶץ.
4.english: They turn the needy out of the way; the poor of the earth hide themselves together.

5.hebrew: הֵן פְּרָאִים, בַּמִּדְבָּר--    יָצְאוּ בְּפָעֳלָם, מְשַׁחֲרֵי לַטָּרֶף;עֲרָבָה לוֹ לֶחֶם,    לַנְּעָרִים.
5.english: Behold, as wild asses in the wilderness they go forth to their work, seeking diligently for food; {N}the desert yieldeth them bread for their children.

6.hebrew: בַּשָּׂדֶה, בְּלִילוֹ יקצירו (יִקְצוֹרוּ);    וְכֶרֶם רָשָׁע יְלַקֵּשׁוּ.
6.english: They cut his provender in the field; and they despoil the vineyard of the wicked.

7.hebrew: עָרוֹם יָלִינוּ, מִבְּלִי לְבוּשׁ;    וְאֵין כְּסוּת, בַּקָּרָה.
7.english: They lie all night naked without clothing, and have no covering in the cold.

8.hebrew: מִזֶּרֶם הָרִים יִרְטָבוּ;    וּמִבְּלִי מַחְסֶה, חִבְּקוּ-צוּר.
8.english: They are wet with the showers of the mountains, and embrace the rock for want of a shelter.

9.hebrew: יִגְזְלוּ, מִשֹּׁד יָתוֹם;    וְעַל-עָנִי יַחְבֹּלוּ.
9.english: There are that pluck the fatherless from the breast, and take a pledge of the poor;

10.hebrew: עָרוֹם הִלְּכוּ, בְּלִי לְבוּשׁ;    וּרְעֵבִים, נָשְׂאוּ עֹמֶר.
10.english: So that they go about naked without clothing, and being hungry they carry the sheaves;

11.hebrew: בֵּין-שׁוּרֹתָם יַצְהִירוּ;    יְקָבִים דָּרְכוּ, וַיִּצְמָאוּ.
11.english: They make oil within the rows of these men; they tread their winepresses, and suffer thirst.

12.hebrew: מֵעִיר מְתִים, יִנְאָקוּ--    וְנֶפֶשׁ-חֲלָלִים תְּשַׁוֵּעַ:וֶאֱלוֹהַּ,    לֹא-יָשִׂים תִּפְלָה.
12.english: From out of the populous city men groan, and the soul of the wounded crieth out; {N}yet God imputeth it not for unseemliness.

13.hebrew: הֵמָּה, הָיוּ--בְּמֹרְדֵי-אוֹר:    לֹא-הִכִּירוּ דְרָכָיו; וְלֹא יָשְׁבוּ, בִּנְתִיבֹתָיו.
13.english: These are of them that rebel against the light; they know not the ways thereof, nor abide in the paths thereof.

14.hebrew: לָאוֹר, יָקוּם רוֹצֵחַ--יִקְטָל-עָנִי וְאֶבְיוֹן;    וּבַלַּיְלָה, יְהִי כַגַּנָּב.
14.english: The murderer riseth with the light, to kill the poor and needy; and in the night he is as a thief.

15.hebrew: וְעֵין נֹאֵף, שָׁמְרָה נֶשֶׁף לֵאמֹר--    לֹא-תְשׁוּרֵנִי עָיִן;וְסֵתֶר פָּנִים    יָשִׂים.
15.english: The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight, saying: 'No eye shall see me'; {N}and he putteth a covering on his face.

16.hebrew: חָתַר בַּחֹשֶׁךְ, בָּתִּים:    יוֹמָם חִתְּמוּ-לָמוֹ; לֹא-יָדְעוּ אוֹר.
16.english: In the dark they dig through houses; they shut themselves up in the day-time; they know not the light.

17.hebrew: כִּי יַחְדָּו, בֹּקֶר לָמוֹ צַלְמָוֶת;    כִּי-יַכִּיר, בַּלְהוֹת צַלְמָוֶת.
17.english: For the shadow of death is to all of them as the morning; for they know the terrors of the shadow of death.

18.hebrew: קַל-הוּא, עַל-פְּנֵי-מַיִם--    תְּקֻלַּל חֶלְקָתָם בָּאָרֶץ;לֹא-יִפְנֶה,    דֶּרֶךְ כְּרָמִים.
18.english: He is swift upon the face of the waters; their portion is cursed in the earth; {N}he turneth not by the way of the vineyards.

19.hebrew: צִיָּה גַם-חֹם, יִגְזְלוּ מֵימֵי-שֶׁלֶג;    שְׁאוֹל חָטָאוּ.
19.english: Drought and heat consume the snow waters; so doth the nether-world those that have sinned.

20.hebrew: יִשְׁכָּחֵהוּ רֶחֶם, מְתָקוֹ רִמָּה--    עוֹד לֹא-יִזָּכֵר;וַתִּשָּׁבֵר כָּעֵץ    עַוְלָה.
20.english: The womb forgetteth him; the worm feedeth sweetly on him; he shall be no more remembered; {N}and unrighteousness is broken as a tree.

21.hebrew: רֹעֶה עֲקָרָה, לֹא תֵלֵד;    וְאַלְמָנָה, לֹא יְיֵטִיב.
21.english: He devoureth the barren that beareth not; and doeth not good to the widow.

22.hebrew: וּמָשַׁךְ אַבִּירִים בְּכֹחוֹ;    יָקוּם, וְלֹא-יַאֲמִין בַּחַיִּין.
22.english: He draweth away the mighty also by his power; he riseth up, and he trusteth not his own life.

23.hebrew: יִתֶּן-לוֹ לָבֶטַח, וְיִשָּׁעֵן;    וְעֵינֵיהוּ, עַל-דַּרְכֵיהֶם.
23.english: Though it be given him to be in safety, whereon he resteth, yet His eyes are upon their ways.

24.hebrew: רוֹמּוּ מְּעַט, וְאֵינֶנּוּ,    וְהֻמְּכוּ, כַּכֹּל יִקָּפְצוּן;וּכְרֹאשׁ שִׁבֹּלֶת    יִמָּלוּ.
24.english: They are exalted for a little while, and they are gone; yea, they are brought low, they are gathered in as all others, {N}and wither as the tops of the ears of corn.

25.hebrew: וְאִם-לֹא אֵפוֹ, מִי יַכְזִיבֵנִי;    וְיָשֵׂם לְאַל, מִלָּתִי.
25.english: And if it be not so now, who will prove me a liar, and make my speech nothing worth?

1.english: {S} Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said:

2.hebrew: הַמְשֵׁל וָפַחַד עִמּוֹ;    עֹשֶׂה שָׁלוֹם, בִּמְרוֹמָיו.
2.english: Dominion and fear are with Him; He maketh peace in His high places.

3.hebrew: הֲיֵשׁ מִסְפָּר, לִגְדוּדָיו;    וְעַל-מִי, לֹא-יָקוּם אוֹרֵהוּ.
3.english: Is there any number of His armies? And upon whom doth not His light arise?

4.hebrew: וּמַה-יִּצְדַּק אֱנוֹשׁ עִם-אֵל;    וּמַה-יִּזְכֶּה, יְלוּד אִשָּׁה.
4.english: How then can man be just with God? Or how can he be clean that is born of a woman?

5.hebrew: הֵן עַד-יָרֵחַ, וְלֹא יַאֲהִיל;    וְכוֹכָבִים, לֹא-זַכּוּ בְעֵינָיו.
5.english: Behold, even the moon hath no brightness, and the stars are not pure in His sight;

6.hebrew: אַף, כִּי-אֱנוֹשׁ רִמָּה;    וּבֶן-אָדָם, תּוֹלֵעָה.
6.english: How much less man, that is a worm! and the son of man, that is a maggot!

1.english: {S} Then Job answered and said:

2.hebrew: מֶה-עָזַרְתָּ, לְלֹא-כֹחַ;    הוֹשַׁעְתָּ, זְרוֹעַ לֹא-עֹז.
2.english: How hast thou helped him that is without power! How hast thou saved the arm that hath no strength!

3.hebrew: מַה-יָּעַצְתָּ, לְלֹא חָכְמָה;    וְתֻשִׁיָּה, לָרֹב הוֹדָעְתָּ.
3.english: How hast thou counselled him that hath no wisdom, and plentifully declared sound knowledge!

4.hebrew: אֶת-מִי, הִגַּדְתָּ מִלִּין;    וְנִשְׁמַת-מִי, יָצְאָה מִמֶּךָּ.
4.english: With whose help hast thou uttered words? And whose spirit came forth from thee?

5.hebrew: הָרְפָאִים יְחוֹלָלוּ--    מִתַּחַת מַיִם, וְשֹׁכְנֵיהֶם.
5.english: The shades tremble beneath the waters and the inhabitants thereof.

6.hebrew: עָרוֹם שְׁאוֹל נֶגְדּוֹ;    וְאֵין כְּסוּת, לָאֲבַדּוֹן.
6.english: The nether-world is naked before Him, and Destruction hath no covering.

7.hebrew: נֹטֶה צָפוֹן עַל-תֹּהוּ;    תֹּלֶה אֶרֶץ, עַל-בְּלִי-מָה.
7.english: He stretcheth out the north over the empty space, and hangeth the earth over nothing.

8.hebrew: צֹרֵר-מַיִם בְּעָבָיו;    וְלֹא-נִבְקַע עָנָן תַּחְתָּם.
8.english: He bindeth up the waters in His thick clouds; and the cloud is not rent under them.

9.hebrew: מְאַחֵז פְּנֵי-כִסֵּה;    פַּרְשֵׁז עָלָיו עֲנָנוֹ.
9.english: He closeth in the face of His throne, and spreadeth His cloud upon it.

10.hebrew: חֹק-חָג, עַל-פְּנֵי-מָיִם--    עַד-תַּכְלִית אוֹר עִם-חֹשֶׁךְ.
10.english: He hath described a boundary upon the face of the waters, unto the confines of light and darkness.

11.hebrew: עַמּוּדֵי שָׁמַיִם יְרוֹפָפוּ;    וְיִתְמְהוּ, מִגַּעֲרָתוֹ.
11.english: The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at His rebuke.

12.hebrew: בְּכֹחוֹ, רָגַע הַיָּם;    ובתובנתו (וּבִתְבוּנָתוֹ), מָחַץ רָהַב.
12.english: He stirreth up the sea with His power, and by His understanding He smiteth through Rahab.

13.hebrew: בְּרוּחוֹ, שָׁמַיִם שִׁפְרָה;    חֹלְלָה יָדוֹ, נָחָשׁ בָּרִחַ.
13.english: By His breath the heavens are serene; His hand hath pierced the slant serpent.

14.hebrew: הֶן-אֵלֶּה, קְצוֹת דְּרָכָו--    וּמַה-שֵּׁמֶץ דָּבָר, נִשְׁמַע-בּוֹ;וְרַעַם גְּבוּרֹתָו,    מִי יִתְבּוֹנָן.
14.english: Lo, these are but the outskirts of His ways; and how small a whisper is heard of Him! {N}But the thunder of His mighty deeds who can understand?

1.english: {S} And Job again took up his parable, and said:

2.hebrew: חַי-אֵל, הֵסִיר מִשְׁפָּטִי;    וְשַׁדַּי, הֵמַר נַפְשִׁי.
2.english: As God liveth, who hath taken away my right; and the Almighty, who hath dealt bitterly with me;

3.hebrew: כִּי-כָל-עוֹד נִשְׁמָתִי בִי;    וְרוּחַ אֱלוֹהַּ בְּאַפִּי.
3.english: All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils,

4.hebrew: אִם-תְּדַבֵּרְנָה שְׂפָתַי עַוְלָה;    וּלְשׁוֹנִי, אִם-יֶהְגֶּה רְמִיָּה.
4.english: Surely my lips shall not speak unrighteousness, neither shall my tongue utter deceit;

5.hebrew: חָלִילָה לִּי,    אִם-אַצְדִּיק אֶתְכֶם:עַד-אֶגְוָע--    לֹא-אָסִיר תֻּמָּתִי מִמֶּנִּי.
5.english: Far be it from me that I should justify you; {N}till I die I will not put away mine integrity from me.

6.hebrew: בְּצִדְקָתִי הֶחֱזַקְתִּי, וְלֹא אַרְפֶּהָ;    לֹא-יֶחֱרַף לְבָבִי, מִיָּמָי.
6.english: My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go; my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.

7.hebrew: יְהִי כְרָשָׁע, אֹיְבִי;    וּמִתְקוֹמְמִי כְעַוָּל.
7.english: Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and let him that riseth up against me be as the unrighteous.

8.hebrew: כִּי מַה-תִּקְוַת חָנֵף, כִּי יִבְצָע;    כִּי יֵשֶׁל אֱלוֹהַּ נַפְשׁוֹ.
8.english: For what is the hope of the godless, though he get him gain, when God taketh away his soul?

9.hebrew: הֲצַעֲקָתוֹ, יִשְׁמַע אֵל--    כִּי-תָבוֹא עָלָיו צָרָה.
9.english: Will God hear his cry, when trouble cometh upon him?

10.hebrew: אִם-עַל-שַׁדַּי יִתְעַנָּג;    יִקְרָא אֱלוֹהַּ בְּכָל-עֵת.
10.english: Will he have his delight in the Almighty, and call upon God at all times?

11.hebrew: אוֹרֶה אֶתְכֶם בְּיַד-אֵל;    אֲשֶׁר עִם-שַׁדַּי, לֹא אֲכַחֵד.
11.english: I will teach you concerning the hand of God; that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.

12.hebrew: הֵן-אַתֶּם כֻּלְּכֶם חֲזִיתֶם;    וְלָמָּה-זֶּה, הֶבֶל תֶּהְבָּלוּ.
12.english: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye become altogether vain?

13.hebrew: זֶה, חֵלֶק-אָדָם רָשָׁע עִם-אֵל;    וְנַחֲלַת עָרִיצִים, מִשַּׁדַּי יִקָּחוּ.
13.english: This is the portion of a wicked man with God, and the heritage of oppressors, which they receive from the Almighty.

14.hebrew: אִם-יִרְבּוּ בָנָיו לְמוֹ-חָרֶב;    וְצֶאֱצָאָיו, לֹא יִשְׂבְּעוּ-לָחֶם.
14.english: If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword; and his offspring shall not have bread enough.

15.hebrew: שְׂרִידָו, בַּמָּוֶת יִקָּבֵרוּ;    וְאַלְמְנֹתָיו, לֹא תִבְכֶּינָה.
15.english: Those that remain of him shall be buried by pestilence, and his widows shall make no lamentation.

16.hebrew: אִם-יִצְבֹּר כֶּעָפָר כָּסֶף;    וְכַחֹמֶר, יָכִין מַלְבּוּשׁ.
16.english: Though he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay;

17.hebrew: יָכִין, וְצַדִּיק יִלְבָּשׁ;    וְכֶסֶף, נָקִי יַחֲלֹק.
17.english: He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.

18.hebrew: בָּנָה כָעָשׁ בֵּיתוֹ;    וּכְסֻכָּה, עָשָׂה נֹצֵר.
18.english: He buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth which the keeper maketh.

19.hebrew: עָשִׁיר יִשְׁכַּב, וְלֹא יֵאָסֵף;    עֵינָיו פָּקַח וְאֵינֶנּוּ.
19.english: He lieth down rich, but there shall be nought to gather; he openeth his eyes, and his wealth is not.

20.hebrew: תַּשִּׂיגֵהוּ כַמַּיִם, בַּלָּהוֹת;    לַיְלָה, גְּנָבַתּוּ סוּפָה.
20.english: Terrors overtake him like waters; a tempest stealeth him away in the night.

21.hebrew: יִשָּׂאֵהוּ קָדִים וְיֵלַךְ;    וִישָׂעֲרֵהוּ, מִמְּקֹמוֹ.
21.english: The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth; and it sweepeth him out of his place.

22.hebrew: וְיַשְׁלֵךְ עָלָיו, וְלֹא יַחְמֹל;    מִיָּדוֹ, בָּרוֹחַ יִבְרָח.
22.english: Yea, it hurleth at him, and spareth not; he would fain flee from its power.

23.hebrew: יִשְׂפֹּק עָלֵימוֹ כַפֵּימוֹ;    וְיִשְׁרֹק עָלָיו, מִמְּקֹמוֹ.
23.english: Men shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.

1.hebrew: כִּי יֵשׁ לַכֶּסֶף מוֹצָא;    וּמָקוֹם, לַזָּהָב יָזֹקּוּ.
1.english: For there is a mine for silver, and a place for gold which they refine.

2.hebrew: בַּרְזֶל, מֵעָפָר יֻקָּח;    וְאֶבֶן, יָצוּק נְחוּשָׁה.
2.english: Iron is taken out of the dust, and brass is molten out of the stone.

3.hebrew: קֵץ, שָׂם לַחֹשֶׁךְ, וּלְכָל-תַּכְלִית, הוּא חוֹקֵר:    אֶבֶן אֹפֶל וְצַלְמָוֶת.
3.english: Man setteth an end to darkness, and searcheth out to the furthest bound the stones of thick darkness and of the shadow of death.

4.hebrew: פָּרַץ נַחַל, מֵעִם-גָּר--הַנִּשְׁכָּחִים מִנִּי-רָגֶל;    דַּלּוּ מֵאֱנוֹשׁ נָעוּ.
4.english: He breaketh open a shaft away from where men sojourn; they are forgotten of the foot that passeth by; they hang afar from men, they swing to and fro.

5.hebrew: אֶרֶץ--מִמֶּנָּה יֵצֵא-לָחֶם;    וְתַחְתֶּיהָ, נֶהְפַּךְ כְּמוֹ-אֵשׁ.
5.english: As for the earth, out of it cometh bread, and underneath it is turned up as it were by fire.

6.hebrew: מְקוֹם-סַפִּיר אֲבָנֶיהָ;    וְעַפְרֹת זָהָב לוֹ.
6.english: The stones thereof are the place of sapphires, and it hath dust of gold.

7.hebrew: נָתִיב, לֹא-יְדָעוֹ עָיִט;    וְלֹא שְׁזָפַתּוּ, עֵין אַיָּה.
7.english: That path no bird of prey knoweth, neither hath the falcon's eye seen it;

8.hebrew: לֹא-הִדְרִיכוּהוּ בְנֵי-שָׁחַץ;    לֹא-עָדָה עָלָיו שָׁחַל.
8.english: The proud beasts have not trodden it, nor hath the lion passed thereby.

9.hebrew: בַּחַלָּמִישׁ, שָׁלַח יָדוֹ;    הָפַךְ מִשֹּׁרֶשׁ הָרִים.
9.english: He putteth forth his hand upon the flinty rock; He overturneth the mountains by the roots.

10.hebrew: בַּצּוּרוֹת, יְאֹרִים בִּקֵּעַ;    וְכָל-יְקָר, רָאֲתָה עֵינוֹ.
10.english: He cutteth out channels among the rocks; and his eye seeth every precious thing.

11.hebrew: מִבְּכִי, נְהָרוֹת חִבֵּשׁ;    וְתַעֲלֻמָהּ, יֹצִא אוֹר.
11.english: He bindeth the streams that they trickle not; and the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light. {P}

12.hebrew: וְהַחָכְמָה, מֵאַיִן תִּמָּצֵא;    וְאֵי זֶה, מְקוֹם בִּינָה.
12.english: But wisdom, where shall it be found? And where is the place of understanding?

13.hebrew: לֹא-יָדַע אֱנוֹשׁ עֶרְכָּהּ;    וְלֹא תִמָּצֵא, בְּאֶרֶץ הַחַיִּים.
13.english: Man knoweth not the price thereof; neither is it found in the land of the living.

14.hebrew: תְּהוֹם אָמַר, לֹא בִי-הִיא;    וְיָם אָמַר, אֵין עִמָּדִי.
14.english: The deep saith: 'It is not in me'; and the sea saith: 'It is not with me.'

15.hebrew: לֹא-יֻתַּן סְגוֹר תַּחְתֶּיהָ;    וְלֹא יִשָּׁקֵל, כֶּסֶף מְחִירָהּ.
15.english: It cannot be gotten for gold, neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.

16.hebrew: לֹא-תְסֻלֶּה, בְּכֶתֶם אוֹפִיר;    בְּשֹׁהַם יָקָר וְסַפִּיר.
16.english: It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, or the sapphire.

17.hebrew: לֹא-יַעַרְכֶנָּה זָהָב, וּזְכוֹכִית;    וּתְמוּרָתָהּ כְּלִי-פָז.
17.english: Gold and glass cannot equal it; neither shall the exchange thereof be vessels of fine gold.

18.hebrew: רָאמוֹת וְגָבִישׁ, לֹא יִזָּכֵר;    וּמֶשֶׁךְ חָכְמָה, מִפְּנִינִים.
18.english: No mention shall be made of coral or of crystal; yea, the price of wisdom is above rubies.

19.hebrew: לֹא-יַעַרְכֶנָּה, פִּטְדַת-כּוּשׁ;    בְּכֶתֶם טָהוֹר, לֹא תְסֻלֶּה.
19.english: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, neither shall it be valued with pure gold.

20.hebrew: וְהַחָכְמָה, מֵאַיִן תָּבוֹא;    וְאֵי זֶה, מְקוֹם בִּינָה.
20.english: Whence then cometh wisdom? And where is the place of understanding?

21.hebrew: וְנֶעֶלְמָה, מֵעֵינֵי כָל-חָי;    וּמֵעוֹף הַשָּׁמַיִם נִסְתָּרָה.
21.english: Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living, and kept close from the fowls of the air.

22.hebrew: אֲבַדּוֹן וָמָוֶת, אָמְרוּ;    בְּאָזְנֵינוּ, שָׁמַעְנוּ שִׁמְעָהּ.
22.english: Destruction and Death say: 'We have heard a rumor thereof with our ears.'

23.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים, הֵבִין דַּרְכָּהּ;    וְהוּא, יָדַע אֶת-מְקוֹמָהּ.
23.english: God understandeth the way thereof, and He knoweth the place thereof.

24.hebrew: כִּי-הוּא, לִקְצוֹת-הָאָרֶץ יַבִּיט;    תַּחַת כָּל-הַשָּׁמַיִם יִרְאֶה.
24.english: For He looketh to the ends of the earth, and seeth under the whole heaven;

25.hebrew: לַעֲשׂוֹת לָרוּחַ מִשְׁקָל;    וּמַיִם, תִּכֵּן בְּמִדָּה.
25.english: When He maketh a weight for the wind, and meteth out the waters by measure.

26.hebrew: בַּעֲשֹׂתוֹ לַמָּטָר חֹק;    וְדֶרֶךְ, לַחֲזִיז קֹלוֹת.
26.english: When He made a decree for the rain, and a way for the storm of thunders;

27.english: Then did He see it, and declare it; He established it, yea, and searched it out.

28.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר, לָאָדָם--הֵן יִרְאַת אֲדֹנָי, הִיא חָכְמָה;    וְסוּר מֵרָע בִּינָה.
28.english: And unto man He said: 'Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.'

1.english: {S} And Job again took up his parable, and said:

2.hebrew: מִי-יִתְּנֵנִי כְיַרְחֵי-קֶדֶם;    כִּימֵי, אֱלוֹהַּ יִשְׁמְרֵנִי.
2.english: Oh that I were as in the months of old, as in the days when God watched over me;

3.hebrew: בְּהִלּוֹ נֵרוֹ, עֲלֵי רֹאשִׁי;    לְאוֹרוֹ, אֵלֶךְ חֹשֶׁךְ.
3.english: When His lamp shined above my head, and by His light I walked through darkness;

4.hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁר הָיִיתִי, בִּימֵי חָרְפִּי;    בְּסוֹד אֱלוֹהַּ, עֲלֵי אָהֳלִי.
4.english: As I was in the days of my youth, when the converse of God was upon my tent;

5.hebrew: בְּעוֹד שַׁדַּי, עִמָּדִי;    סְבִיבוֹתַי נְעָרָי.
5.english: When the Almighty was yet with me, and my children were about me;

6.hebrew: בִּרְחֹץ הֲלִיכַי בְּחֵמָה;    וְצוּר יָצוּק עִמָּדִי, פַּלְגֵי-שָׁמֶן.
6.english: When my steps were washed with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil!

7.hebrew: בְּצֵאתִי שַׁעַר עֲלֵי-קָרֶת;    בָּרְחוֹב, אָכִין מוֹשָׁבִי.
7.english: When I went forth to the gate unto the city, when I prepared my seat in the broad place,

8.hebrew: רָאוּנִי נְעָרִים וְנֶחְבָּאוּ;    וִישִׁישִׁים, קָמוּ עָמָדוּ.
8.english: The young men saw me and hid themselves, and the aged rose up and stood;

9.hebrew: שָׂרִים, עָצְרוּ בְמִלִּים;    וְכַף, יָשִׂימוּ לְפִיהֶם.
9.english: The princes refrained talking, and laid their hand on their mouth;

10.hebrew: קוֹל-נְגִידִים נֶחְבָּאוּ;    וּלְשׁוֹנָם, לְחִכָּם דָּבֵקָה.
10.english: The voice of the nobles was hushed, and their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.

11.hebrew: כִּי אֹזֶן שָׁמְעָה, וַתְּאַשְּׁרֵנִי;    וְעַיִן רָאֲתָה, וַתְּעִידֵנִי.
11.english: For when the ear heard me, then it blessed me, and when the eye saw me, it gave witness unto me;

12.hebrew: כִּי-אֲמַלֵּט, עָנִי מְשַׁוֵּעַ;    וְיָתוֹם, וְלֹא-עֹזֵר לוֹ.
12.english: Because I delivered the poor that cried, the fatherless also, that had none to help him.

13.hebrew: בִּרְכַּת אֹבֵד, עָלַי תָּבֹא;    וְלֵב אַלְמָנָה אַרְנִן.
13.english: The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me; and I caused the widow's heart to sing for joy.

14.hebrew: צֶדֶק לָבַשְׁתִּי, וַיִּלְבָּשֵׁנִי;    כִּמְעִיל וְצָנִיף, מִשְׁפָּטִי.
14.english: I put on righteousness, and it clothed itself with me; my justice was as a robe and a diadem.

15.hebrew: עֵינַיִם הָיִיתִי, לַעִוֵּר;    וְרַגְלַיִם לַפִּסֵּחַ אָנִי.
15.english: I was eyes to the blind, and feet was I to the lame.

16.hebrew: אָב אָנֹכִי, לָאֶבְיוֹנִים;    וְרִב לֹא-יָדַעְתִּי אֶחְקְרֵהוּ.
16.english: I was a father to the needy; and the cause of him that I knew not I searched out.

17.hebrew: וָאֲשַׁבְּרָה, מְתַלְּעוֹת עַוָּל;    וּמִשִּׁנָּיו, אַשְׁלִיךְ טָרֶף.
17.english: And I broke the jaws of the unrighteous, and plucked the prey out of his teeth.

18.hebrew: וָאֹמַר, עִם-קִנִּי אֶגְוָע;    וְכַחוֹל, אַרְבֶּה יָמִים.
18.english: Then I said: 'I shall die with my nest, and I shall multiply my days as the phoenix;

19.hebrew: שָׁרְשִׁי פָתוּחַ אֱלֵי-מָיִם;    וְטַל, יָלִין בִּקְצִירִי.
19.english: My root shall be spread out to the waters, and the dew shall lie all night upon my branch;

20.hebrew: כְּבוֹדִי, חָדָשׁ עִמָּדִי;    וְקַשְׁתִּי, בְּיָדִי תַחֲלִיף.
20.english: My glory shall be fresh in me, and my bow shall be renewed in my hand.'

21.hebrew: לִי-שָׁמְעוּ וְיִחֵלּוּ;    וְיִדְּמוּ, לְמוֹ עֲצָתִי.
21.english: Unto me men gave ear, and waited, and kept silence for my counsel.

22.hebrew: אַחֲרֵי דְבָרִי, לֹא יִשְׁנוּ;    וְעָלֵימוֹ, תִּטֹּף מִלָּתִי.
22.english: After my words they spoke not again; and my speech dropped upon them.

23.hebrew: וְיִחֲלוּ כַמָּטָר לִי;    וּפִיהֶם, פָּעֲרוּ לְמַלְקוֹשׁ.
23.english: And they waited for me as for the rain; and they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.

24.hebrew: אֶשְׂחַק אֲלֵהֶם, לֹא יַאֲמִינוּ;    וְאוֹר פָּנַי, לֹא יַפִּילוּן.
24.english: If I laughed on them, they believed it not; and the light of my countenance they cast not down.

25.hebrew: אֶבְחַר דַּרְכָּם,    וְאֵשֵׁב רֹאשׁ:וְאֶשְׁכּוֹן, כְּמֶלֶךְ בַּגְּדוּד;    כַּאֲשֶׁר אֲבֵלִים יְנַחֵם.
25.english: I chose out their way, and sat as chief, {N}and dwelt as a king in the army, as one that comforteth the mourners.

1.hebrew: וְעַתָּה, שָׂחֲקוּ עָלַי--    צְעִירִים מִמֶּנִּי, לְיָמִים:אֲשֶׁר-מָאַסְתִּי אֲבוֹתָם--    לָשִׁית, עִם-כַּלְבֵי צֹאנִי.
1.english: But now they that are younger than I have me in derision, {N}whose fathers I disdained to set with the dogs of my flock.

2.hebrew: גַּם-כֹּחַ יְדֵיהֶם, לָמָּה לִּי;    עָלֵימוֹ, אָבַד כָּלַח.
2.english: Yea, the strength of their hands, whereto should it profit me? men in whom ripe age is perished.

3.hebrew: בְּחֶסֶר וּבְכָפָן, גַּלְמוּד:    הַעֹרְקִים צִיָּה--אֶמֶשׁ, שׁוֹאָה וּמְשֹׁאָה.
3.english: They are gaunt with want and famine; they gnaw the dry ground, in the gloom of wasteness and desolation.

4.hebrew: הַקֹּטְפִים מַלּוּחַ עֲלֵי-שִׂיחַ;    וְשֹׁרֶשׁ רְתָמִים לַחְמָם.
4.english: They pluck salt-wort with wormwood; and the roots of the broom are their food.

5.hebrew: מִן-גֵּו יְגֹרָשׁוּ;    יָרִיעוּ עָלֵימוֹ, כַּגַּנָּב.
5.english: They are driven forth from the midst of men; they cry after them as after a thief.

6.hebrew: בַּעֲרוּץ נְחָלִים לִשְׁכֹּן;    חֹרֵי עָפָר וְכֵפִים.
6.english: In the clefts of the valleys must they dwell, in holes of the earth and of the rocks.

7.hebrew: בֵּין-שִׂיחִים יִנְהָקוּ;    תַּחַת חָרוּל יְסֻפָּחוּ.
7.english: Among the bushes they bray; under the nettles they are gathered together.

8.hebrew: בְּנֵי-נָבָל, גַּם-בְּנֵי בְלִי-שֵׁם--    נִכְּאוּ, מִן-הָאָרֶץ.
8.english: They are children of churls, yea, children of ignoble men; they were scourged out of the land.

9.hebrew: וְעַתָּה, נְגִינָתָם הָיִיתִי;    וָאֱהִי לָהֶם לְמִלָּה.
9.english: And now I am become their song, yea, I am a byword unto them.

10.hebrew: תִּעֲבוּנִי, רָחֲקוּ מֶנִּי;    וּמִפָּנַי, לֹא-חָשְׂכוּ רֹק.
10.english: They abhor me, they flee far from me, and spare not to spit in my face.

11.hebrew: כִּי-יתרו (יִתְרִי) פִתַּח, וַיְעַנֵּנִי;    וְרֶסֶן, מִפָּנַי שִׁלֵּחוּ.
11.english: For He hath loosed my cord, and afflicted me, and they have cast off the bridle before me.

12.hebrew: עַל-יָמִין, פִּרְחַח יָקוּמוּ:    רַגְלַי שִׁלֵּחוּ; וַיָּסֹלּוּ עָלַי, אָרְחוֹת אֵידָם.
12.english: Upon my right hand rise the brood; they entangle my feet, and they cast up against me their ways of destruction.

13.hebrew: נָתְסוּ, נְתִיבָתִי:    לְהַוָּתִי יֹעִילוּ; לֹא עֹזֵר לָמוֹ.
13.english: They break up my path, they further my calamity, even men that have no helper.

14.hebrew: כְּפֶרֶץ רָחָב יֶאֱתָיוּ;    תַּחַת שֹׁאָה, הִתְגַּלְגָּלוּ.
14.english: As through a wide breach they come; in the midst of the ruin they roll themselves upon me.

15.hebrew: הָהְפַּךְ עָלַי,    בַּלָּהוֹת:תִּרְדֹּף כָּרוּחַ, נְדִבָתִי;    וּכְעָב, עָבְרָה יְשֻׁעָתִי.
15.english: Terrors are turned upon me, {N}they chase mine honour as the wind; and my welfare is passed away as a cloud.

16.hebrew: וְעַתָּה--עָלַי, תִּשְׁתַּפֵּךְ נַפְשִׁי;    יֹאחֲזוּנִי יְמֵי-עֹנִי.
16.english: And now my soul is poured out within me; days of affliction have taken hold upon me.

17.hebrew: לַיְלָה--עֲצָמַי, נִקַּר מֵעָלָי;    וְעֹרְקַי, לֹא יִשְׁכָּבוּן.
17.english: In the night my bones are pierced, and fall from me, and my sinews take no rest.

18.hebrew: בְּרָב-כֹּחַ, יִתְחַפֵּשׂ לְבוּשִׁי;    כְּפִי כֻתָּנְתִּי יַאַזְרֵנִי.
18.english: By the great force [of my disease] is my garment disfigured; it bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.

19.hebrew: הֹרָנִי לַחֹמֶר;    וָאֶתְמַשֵּׁל, כֶּעָפָר וָאֵפֶר.
19.english: He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.

20.hebrew: אֲשַׁוַּע אֵלֶיךָ, וְלֹא תַעֲנֵנִי;    עָמַדְתִּי, וַתִּתְבֹּנֶן בִּי.
20.english: I cry unto Thee, and Thou dost not answer me; I stand up, and Thou lookest at me.

21.hebrew: תֵּהָפֵךְ לְאַכְזָר לִי;    בְּעֹצֶם יָדְךָ תִשְׂטְמֵנִי.
21.english: Thou art turned to be cruel to me; with the might of Thy hand Thou hatest me.

22.hebrew: תִּשָּׂאֵנִי אֶל-רוּחַ, תַּרְכִּיבֵנִי;    וּתְמֹגְגֵנִי, תשוה (תֻּשִׁיָּה).
22.english: Thou liftest me up to the wind, Thou causest me to ride upon it; and Thou dissolvest my substance.

23.hebrew: כִּי-יָדַעְתִּי, מָוֶת תְּשִׁיבֵנִי;    וּבֵית מוֹעֵד לְכָל-חָי.
23.english: For I know that Thou wilt bring me to death, and to the house appointed for all living.

24.hebrew: אַךְ לֹא-בְעִי, יִשְׁלַח-יָד;    אִם-בְּפִידוֹ, לָהֶן שׁוּעַ.
24.english: Surely none shall put forth his hand to a ruinous heap, neither because of these things shall help come in one's calamity,

25.hebrew: אִם-לֹא בָכִיתִי, לִקְשֵׁה-יוֹם;    עָגְמָה נַפְשִׁי, לָאֶבְיוֹן.
25.english: If I have not wept for him that was in trouble, and if my soul grieved not for the needy.

26.hebrew: כִּי טוֹב קִוִּיתִי, וַיָּבֹא רָע;    וַאֲיַחֲלָה לְאוֹר, וַיָּבֹא אֹפֶל.
26.english: Yet, when I looked for good, there came evil; and when I waited for light, there came darkness.

27.english: Mine inwards boil, and rest not; days of affliction are come upon me.

28.hebrew: קֹדֵר הִלַּכְתִּי, בְּלֹא חַמָּה;    קַמְתִּי בַקָּהָל אֲשַׁוֵּעַ.
28.english: I go mourning without the sun; I stand up in the assembly, and cry for help.

29.hebrew: אָח, הָיִיתִי לְתַנִּים;    וְרֵעַ, לִבְנוֹת יַעֲנָה.
29.english: I am become a brother to jackals, and a companion to ostriches.

30.english: My skin is black, and falleth from me, and my bones are burned with heat.

31.hebrew: וַיְהִי לְאֵבֶל, כִּנֹּרִי;    וְעֻגָבִי, לְקוֹל בֹּכִים.
31.english: Therefore is my harp turned to mourning, and my pipe into the voice of them that weep.

1.hebrew: áÌÀøÄéú, ëÌÈøÇúÌÄé ìÀòÅéğÈé;    åÌîÈä àÆúÀáÌåÉğÅï, òÇì-áÌÀúåÌìÈä.
1.english: I made a covenant with mine eyes; how then should I look upon a maid?

2.hebrew: åÌîÆä, çÅìÆ÷ àÁìåÉäÌÇ îÄîÌÈòÇì;    åÀğÇçÂìÇú ùÑÇãÌÇé, îÄîÌÀøÉîÄéí.
2.english: For what would be the portion of God from above, and the heritage of the Almighty from on high?

3.hebrew: äÂìÉà-àÅéã ìÀòÇåÌÈì;    åÀğÅëÆø, ìÀôÉòÂìÅé àÈåÆï.
3.english: Is it not calamity to the unrighteous, and disaster to the workers of iniquity?

4.hebrew: äÂìÉà-äåÌà, éÄøÀàÆä ãÀøÈëÈé;    åÀëÈì-öÀòÈãÇé éÄñÀôÌåÉø.
4.english: Doth not He see my ways, and count all my steps?

5.english: If I have walked with vanity, and my foot hath hasted to deceit--
