14.english: For God speaketh in one way, yea in two, though man perceiveth it not.

15.hebrew: áÌÇçÂìåÉí, çÆæÀéåÉï ìÇéÀìÈä--áÌÄğÀôÉì úÌÇøÀãÌÅîÈä, òÇì-àÂğÈùÑÄéí;    áÌÄúÀğåÌîåÉú, òÂìÅé îÄùÑÀëÌÈá.
15.english: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;

16.hebrew: àÈæ éÄâÀìÆä, àÉæÆï àÂğÈùÑÄéí;    åÌáÀîÉñÈøÈí éÇçÀúÌÉí.
16.english: Then He openeth the ears of men, and by their chastisement sealeth the decree,

17.hebrew: ìÀäÈñÄéø, àÈãÈí îÇòÂùÒÆä;    åÀâÅåÈä îÄâÌÆáÆø éÀëÇñÌÆä.
17.english: That men may put away their purpose, and that He may hide pride from man;

18.hebrew: éÇçÀùÒÉêÀ ğÇôÀùÑåÉ, îÄğÌÄé-ùÑÈçÇú;    åÀçÇéÌÈúåÉ, îÅòÂáÉø áÌÇùÌÑÈìÇç.
18.english: That He may keep back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.

19.hebrew: åÀäåÌëÇç áÌÀîÇëÀàåÉá, òÇì-îÄùÑÀëÌÈáåÉ;    åøéá (åÀøåÉá) òÂöÈîÈéå àÅúÈï.
19.english: He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and all his bones grow stiff;

20.hebrew: åÀæÄäÂîÇúÌåÌ çÇéÌÈúåÉ ìÈçÆí;    åÀğÇôÀùÑåÉ, îÇàÂëÇì úÌÇàÂåÈä.
20.english: So that his life maketh him to abhor bread, and his soul dainty food.

21.hebrew: éÄëÆì áÌÀùÒÈøåÉ îÅøÉàÄé;    åùôé (åÀùÑËôÌåÌ) òÇöÀîÉúÈéå, ìÉà øËàÌåÌ.
21.english: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones corrode to unsightliness.

22.hebrew: åÇúÌÄ÷ÀøÇá ìÇùÌÑÇçÇú ğÇôÀùÑåÉ;    åÀçÇéÌÈúåÉ, ìÇîÀîÄúÄéí.
22.english: Yea, his soul draweth near unto the pit, and his life to the destroyers.

23.hebrew: àÄí-éÅùÑ òÈìÈéå, îÇìÀàÈêÀ--îÅìÄéõ, àÆçÈã îÄğÌÄé-àÈìÆó:    ìÀäÇâÌÄéã ìÀàÈãÈí éÈùÑÀøåÉ.
23.english: If there be for him an angel, an intercessor, one among a thousand, to vouch for a man's uprightness;

24.hebrew: åÇéÀçËğÌÆğÌåÌ--åÇéÌÉàîÆø, ôÌÀãÈòÅäåÌ îÅøÆãÆú ùÑÈçÇú;    îÈöÈàúÄé ëÉôÆø.
24.english: Then He is gracious unto him, and saith: 'Deliver him from going down to the pit, I have found a ransom.'

25.hebrew: øËèÀôÇùÑ áÌÀùÒÈøåÉ îÄğÌÉòÇø;    éÈùÑåÌá, ìÄéîÅé òÂìåÌîÈéå.
25.english: His flesh is tenderer than a child's; he returneth to the days of his youth;

26.hebrew: éÆòÀúÌÇø àÆì-àÁìåÉäÌÇ, åÇéÌÄøÀöÅäåÌ,    åÇéÌÇøÀà ôÌÈğÈéå, áÌÄúÀøåÌòÈä;åÇéÌÈùÑÆá ìÆàÁğåÉùÑ,    öÄãÀ÷ÈúåÉ.
26.english: He prayeth unto God, and He is favourable unto him; so that he seeth His face with joy; {N}and He restoreth unto man his righteousness.

27.hebrew: éÈùÑÉø, òÇì-àÂğÈùÑÄéí, åÇéÌÉàîÆø, çÈèÈàúÄé åÀéÈùÑÈø äÆòÁåÅéúÄé;    åÀìÉà-ùÑÈåÈä ìÄé.
27.english: He cometh before men, and saith: 'I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not.'

28.hebrew: ôÌÈãÈä ğôùé (ğÇôÀùÑåÉ), îÅòÂáÉø áÌÇùÌÑÈçÇú;    åçéúé (åÀçÇéÌÈúåÉ), áÌÈàåÉø úÌÄøÀàÆä.
28.english: So He redeemeth his soul from going into the pit, and his life beholdeth the light.

29.english: Lo, all these things doth God work, twice, yea thrice, with a man,

30.hebrew: ìÀäÈùÑÄéá ğÇôÀùÑåÉ, îÄğÌÄé-ùÑÈçÇú--    ìÅàåÉø, áÌÀàåÉø äÇçÇéÌÄéí.
30.english: To bring back his soul from the pit, that he may be enlightened with the light of the living.

31.hebrew: äÇ÷ÀùÑÅá àÄéÌåÉá ùÑÀîÇò-ìÄé;    äÇçÂøÅùÑ, åÀàÈğÉëÄé àÂãÇáÌÅø.
31.english: Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me; hold thy peace, and I will speak.

32.english: If thou hast any thing to say, answer me; speak, for I desire to justify thee.

33.hebrew: àÄí-àÇéÄï, àÇúÌÈä ùÑÀîÇò-ìÄé;    äÇçÂøÅùÑ, åÇàÂàÇìÌÆôÀêÈ çÈëÀîÈä.
33.english: If not, hearken thou unto me; hold thy peace, and I will teach thee wisdom.

1.english: {S} Moreover Elihu answered and said:

2.hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ חֲכָמִים מִלָּי;    וְיֹדְעִים, הַאֲזִינוּ לִי.
2.english: Hear my words, ye wise men; and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.

3.hebrew: כִּי-אֹזֶן, מִלִּין תִּבְחָן;    וְחֵךְ, יִטְעַם לֶאֱכֹל.
3.english: For the ear trieth words, as the palate tasteth food.

4.hebrew: מִשְׁפָּט נִבְחֲרָה-לָּנוּ;    נֵדְעָה בֵינֵינוּ מַה-טּוֹב.
4.english: Let us choose for us that which is right; let us know among ourselves what is good.

5.hebrew: כִּי-אָמַר אִיּוֹב צָדַקְתִּי;    וְאֵל, הֵסִיר מִשְׁפָּטִי.
5.english: For Job hath said: 'I am righteous, and God hath taken away my right;

6.hebrew: עַל-מִשְׁפָּטִי אֲכַזֵּב;    אָנוּשׁ חִצִּי בְלִי-פָשַׁע.
6.english: Notwithstanding my right I am accounted a liar; my wound is incurable, though I am without transgression.'

7.hebrew: מִי-גֶבֶר כְּאִיּוֹב;    יִשְׁתֶּה-לַּעַג כַּמָּיִם.
7.english: What man is like Job, who drinketh up scorning like water?

8.hebrew: וְאָרַח לְחֶבְרָה, עִם-פֹּעֲלֵי אָוֶן;    וְלָלֶכֶת, עִם-אַנְשֵׁי-רֶשַׁע.
8.english: Who goeth in company with the workers of iniquity, and walketh with wicked men.

9.hebrew: כִּי-אָמַר, לֹא יִסְכָּן-גָּבֶר--    בִּרְצֹתוֹ, עִם-אֱלֹהִים.
9.english: For he hath said: 'It profiteth a man nothing that he should be in accord with God.'

10.hebrew: לָכֵן, אַנְשֵׁי לֵבָב--    שִׁמְעוּ-לִי:חָלִלָה לָאֵל מֵרֶשַׁע;    וְשַׁדַּי מֵעָוֶל.
10.english: Therefore hearken unto me, ye men of understanding: {N}Far be it from God, that He should do wickedness; and from the Almighty, that He should commit iniquity.

11.hebrew: כִּי פֹעַל אָדָם, יְשַׁלֶּם-לוֹ;    וּכְאֹרַח אִישׁ, יַמְצִאֶנּוּ.
11.english: For the work of a man will He requite unto him, and cause every man to find according to his ways.

12.hebrew: אַף-אָמְנָם, אֵל לֹא-יַרְשִׁיעַ;    וְשַׁדַּי, לֹא-יְעַוֵּת מִשְׁפָּט.
12.english: Yea, of a surety, God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert justice.

13.hebrew: מִי-פָקַד עָלָיו אָרְצָה;    וּמִי שָׂם, תֵּבֵל כֻּלָּהּ.
13.english: Who gave Him a charge over the earth? Or who hath disposed the whole world?

14.hebrew: אִם-יָשִׂים אֵלָיו לִבּוֹ;    רוּחוֹ וְנִשְׁמָתוֹ, אֵלָיו יֶאֱסֹף.
14.english: If He set His heart upon man, if He gather unto Himself his spirit and his breath;

15.hebrew: יִגְוַע כָּל-בָּשָׂר יָחַד;    וְאָדָם, עַל-עָפָר יָשׁוּב.
15.english: All flesh shall perish together, and man shall return unto dust.

16.hebrew: וְאִם-בִּינָה, שִׁמְעָה-זֹּאת;    הַאֲזִינָה, לְקוֹל מִלָּי.
16.english: If now thou hast understanding, hear this; hearken to the voice of my words.

17.hebrew: הַאַף שׂוֹנֵא מִשְׁפָּט יַחֲבוֹשׁ;    וְאִם-צַדִּיק כַּבִּיר תַּרְשִׁיעַ.
17.english: Shall even one that hateth right govern? And wilt thou condemn Him that is just and mighty--

18.hebrew: הַאֲמֹר לְמֶלֶךְ בְּלִיָּעַל--    רָשָׁע, אֶל-נְדִיבִים.
18.english: Is it fit to say to a king: 'Thou art base'? Or to nobles: 'Ye are wicked'?--

19.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר לֹא-נָשָׂא, פְּנֵי שָׂרִים,    וְלֹא נִכַּר-שׁוֹעַ, לִפְנֵי-דָל:כִּי-מַעֲשֵׂה יָדָיו    כֻּלָּם.
19.english: That respecteth not the persons of princes, nor regardeth the rich more than the poor? {N}For they all are the work of His hands.

20.hebrew: רֶגַע, יָמֻתוּ--    וַחֲצוֹת לָיְלָה:יְגֹעֲשׁוּ עָם וְיַעֲבֹרוּ;    וְיָסִירוּ אַבִּיר, לֹא בְיָד.
20.english: In a moment they die, even at midnight; {N}the people are shaken and pass away, and the mighty are taken away without hand.

21.hebrew: כִּי-עֵינָיו, עַל-דַּרְכֵי-אִישׁ;    וְכָל-צְעָדָיו יִרְאֶה.
21.english: For His eyes are upon the ways of a man, and He seeth all his goings.

22.hebrew: אֵין-חֹשֶׁךְ, וְאֵין צַלְמָוֶת--    לְהִסָּתֶר שָׁם, פֹּעֲלֵי אָוֶן.
22.english: There is no darkness, nor shadow of death, where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.

23.hebrew: כִּי לֹא עַל-אִישׁ, יָשִׂים עוֹד--    לַהֲלֹךְ אֶל-אֵל, בַּמִּשְׁפָּט.
23.english: For He doth not appoint a time unto any man, when he should go before God in judgment.

24.hebrew: יָרֹעַ כַּבִּירִים לֹא-חֵקֶר;    וַיַּעֲמֵד אֲחֵרִים תַּחְתָּם.
24.english: He breaketh in pieces mighty men without inquisition, and setteth others in their stead.

25.hebrew: לָכֵן--יַכִּיר, מַעְבָּדֵיהֶם;    וְהָפַךְ לַיְלָה, וְיִדַּכָּאוּ.
25.english: Therefore He taketh knowledge of their works; and He overturneth them in the night, so that they are crushed.

26.hebrew: תַּחַת-רְשָׁעִים סְפָקָם--    בִּמְקוֹם רֹאִים.
26.english: He striketh them as wicked men in the open sight of others;

27.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר עַל-כֵּן, סָרוּ מֵאַחֲרָיו;    וְכָל-דְּרָכָיו, לֹא הִשְׂכִּילוּ.
27.english: Because they turned aside from following Him, and would not have regard to any of His ways;

28.hebrew: לְהָבִיא עָלָיו, צַעֲקַת-דָּל;    וְצַעֲקַת עֲנִיִּים יִשְׁמָע.
28.english: So that they cause the cry of the poor to come unto Him, and He heareth the cry of the afflicted.

29.hebrew: וְהוּא יַשְׁקִט, וּמִי יַרְשִׁעַ--    וְיַסְתֵּר פָּנִים, וּמִי יְשׁוּרֶנּוּ;וְעַל-גּוֹי וְעַל-אָדָם    יָחַד.
29.english: When He giveth quietness, who then can condemn? And when He hideth His face, who then can behold Him? {N}whether it be done unto a nation, or unto a man, alike;

30.english: That the godless man reign not, that there be none to ensnare the people.

31.english: For hath any said unto God: 'I have borne chastisement, though I offend not;

32.hebrew: בִּלְעֲדֵי אֶחֱזֶה, אַתָּה הֹרֵנִי;    אִם-עָוֶל פָּעַלְתִּי, לֹא אֹסִיף.
32.english: That which I see not teach Thou me; if I have done iniquity, I will do it no more'?

33.hebrew: הֲמֵעִמְּךָ יְשַׁלְּמֶנָּה, כִּי-מָאַסְתָּ--כִּי-אַתָּה תִבְחַר וְלֹא-אָנִי;    וּמַה-יָּדַעְתָּ דַבֵּר.
33.english: Shall His recompense be as thou wilt? For thou loathest it, so that thou must choose, and not I; therefore speak what thou knowest.

34.hebrew: אַנְשֵׁי לֵבָב, יֹאמְרוּ לִי;    וְגֶבֶר חָכָם, שֹׁמֵעַ לִי.
34.english: Men of understanding will say unto me, yea, every wise man that heareth me:

35.hebrew: אִיּוֹב, לֹא-בְדַעַת יְדַבֵּר;    וּדְבָרָיו, לֹא בְהַשְׂכֵּיל.
35.english: 'Job speaketh without knowledge, and his words are without discernment.'

36.english: Would that Job were tried unto the end, because of his answering like wicked men.

37.hebrew: כִּי יֹסִיף עַל-חַטָּאתוֹ פֶשַׁע, בֵּינֵינוּ יִשְׂפּוֹק;    וְיֶרֶב אֲמָרָיו לָאֵל.
37.english: For he addeth rebellion unto his sin, he clappeth his hands among us, and multiplieth his words against God.

1.english: {S} Moreover Elihu answered and said:

2.hebrew: הֲזֹאת, חָשַׁבְתָּ לְמִשְׁפָּט;    אָמַרְתָּ, צִדְקִי מֵאֵל.
2.english: Thinkest thou this to be thy right, or sayest thou: 'I am righteousness before God',

3.hebrew: כִּי-תֹאמַר, מַה-יִּסְכָּן-לָךְ;    מָה-אֹעִיל, מֵחַטָּאתִי.
3.english: That thou inquirest: 'What advantage will it be unto Thee?' And: 'What profit shall I have, more than if I had sinned?'

4.hebrew: אֲנִי, אֲשִׁיבְךָ מִלִּין--    וְאֶת-רֵעֶיךָ עִמָּךְ.
4.english: I will give thee answer, and thy companions with thee.

5.hebrew: הַבֵּט שָׁמַיִם וּרְאֵה;    וְשׁוּר שְׁחָקִים, גָּבְהוּ מִמֶּךָּ.
5.english: Look unto the heavens, and see; and behold the skies, which are higher than thou.

6.hebrew: אִם-חָטָאתָ, מַה-תִּפְעָל-בּוֹ;    וְרַבּוּ פְשָׁעֶיךָ, מַה-תַּעֲשֶׂה-לּוֹ.
6.english: If thou hast sinned, what doest thou against Him? And if thy transgressions be multiplied, what doest thou unto Him?

7.hebrew: אִם-צָדַקְתָּ, מַה-תִּתֶּן-לוֹ;    אוֹ מַה-מִּיָּדְךָ יִקָּח.
7.english: If thou be righteous, what givest thou Him? Or what receiveth He of thy hand?

8.hebrew: לְאִישׁ-כָּמוֹךָ רִשְׁעֶךָ;    וּלְבֶן-אָדָם, צִדְקָתֶךָ.
8.english: Thy wickedness concerneth a man as thou art; and thy righteousness a son of man.

9.hebrew: מֵרֹב, עֲשׁוּקִים יַזְעִיקוּ;    יְשַׁוְּעוּ מִזְּרוֹעַ רַבִּים.
9.english: By reason of the multitude of oppressions they cry out; they cry for help by reason of the arm of the mighty.

10.hebrew: וְלֹא-אָמַר--אַיֵּה, אֱלוֹהַּ עֹשָׂי:    נֹתֵן זְמִרוֹת בַּלָּיְלָה.
10.english: But none saith: 'Where is God my Maker, who giveth songs in the night;

11.hebrew: מַלְּפֵנוּ, מִבַּהֲמוֹת אָרֶץ;    וּמֵעוֹף הַשָּׁמַיִם יְחַכְּמֵנוּ.
11.english: Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, and maketh us wiser than the fowls of heaven?'

12.hebrew: שָׁם יִצְעֲקוּ, וְלֹא יַעֲנֶה--    מִפְּנֵי, גְּאוֹן רָעִים.
12.english: There they cry, but none giveth answer, because of the pride of evil men.

13.hebrew: אַךְ-שָׁוְא, לֹא-יִשְׁמַע אֵל;    וְשַׁדַּי, לֹא יְשׁוּרֶנָּה.
13.english: Surely God will not hear vanity, neither will the Almighty regard it.

14.hebrew: אַף כִּי-תֹאמַר, לֹא תְשׁוּרֶנּוּ;    דִּין לְפָנָיו, וּתְחוֹלֵל לוֹ.
14.english: Yea, when thou sayest thou canst not see Him--the cause is before Him; therefore wait thou for Him.

15.hebrew: וְעַתָּה--כִּי-אַיִן, פָּקַד אַפּוֹ;    וְלֹא-יָדַע בַּפַּשׁ מְאֹד.
15.english: And now, is it for nought that He punished in His anger? And hath He not full knowledge of arrogance?

16.hebrew: וְאִיּוֹב, הֶבֶל יִפְצֶה-פִּיהוּ;    בִּבְלִי-דַעַת, מִלִּין יַכְבִּר.
16.english: But Job doth open his mouth in vanity; he multiplieth words without knowledge.

1.english: {S} Elihu also proceeded, and said:

2.hebrew: כַּתַּר-לִי זְעֵיר, וַאֲחַוֶּךָּ:    כִּי עוֹד לֶאֱלוֹהַּ מִלִּים.
2.english: Suffer me a little, and I will tell thee; for there are yet words on God's behalf.

3.hebrew: אֶשָּׂא דֵעִי, לְמֵרָחוֹק;    וּלְפֹעֲלִי, אֶתֵּן-צֶדֶק.
3.english: I will fetch my knowledge from afar, and will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.

4.hebrew: כִּי-אָמְנָם, לֹא-שֶׁקֶר מִלָּי;    תְּמִים דֵּעוֹת עִמָּךְ.
4.english: For truly my words are not false; one that is upright in mind is with thee.

5.hebrew: הֶן-אֵל כַּבִּיר, וְלֹא יִמְאָס:    כַּבִּיר, כֹּחַ לֵב.
5.english: Behold, God is mighty, yet He despiseth not any; He is mighty in strength of understanding.

6.hebrew: לֹא-יְחַיֶּה רָשָׁע;    וּמִשְׁפַּט עֲנִיִּים יִתֵּן.
6.english: He preserveth not the life of the wicked; but giveth to the poor their right.

7.hebrew: לֹא-יִגְרַע מִצַּדִּיק,    עֵינָיו:וְאֶת-מְלָכִים לַכִּסֵּא;    וַיֹּשִׁיבֵם לָנֶצַח, וַיִּגְבָּהוּ.
7.english: He withdraweth not His eyes from the righteous; {N}but with kings upon the throne He setteth them for ever, and they are exalted.

8.hebrew: וְאִם-אֲסוּרִים בַּזִּקִּים;    יִלָּכְדוּן, בְּחַבְלֵי-עֹנִי.
8.english: And if they be bound in fetters, and be holden in cords of affliction;

9.hebrew: וַיַּגֵּד לָהֶם פָּעֳלָם;    וּפִשְׁעֵיהֶם, כִּי יִתְגַּבָּרוּ.
9.english: Then He declareth unto them their work, and their transgressions, that they have behaved themselves proudly.

10.hebrew: וַיִּגֶל אָזְנָם, לַמּוּסָר;    וַיֹּאמֶר, כִּי-יְשׁוּבוּן מֵאָוֶן.
10.english: He openeth also their ear to discipline, and commandeth that they return from iniquity.

11.hebrew: אִם-יִשְׁמְעוּ, וְיַעֲבֹדוּ:    יְכַלּוּ יְמֵיהֶם בַּטּוֹב; וּשְׁנֵיהֶם, בַּנְּעִימִים.
11.english: If they hearken and serve Him, they shall spend their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures.

12.hebrew: וְאִם-לֹא יִשְׁמְעוּ, בְּשֶׁלַח יַעֲבֹרוּ;    וְיִגְוְעוּ, בִּבְלִי-דָעַת.
12.english: But if they hearken not, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without knowledge.

13.hebrew: וְחַנְפֵי-לֵב, יָשִׂימוּ אָף;    לֹא יְשַׁוְּעוּ, כִּי אֲסָרָם.
13.english: But they that are godless in heart lay up anger; they cry not for help when He bindeth them.

14.hebrew: תָּמֹת בַּנֹּעַר נַפְשָׁם;    וְחַיָּתָם, בַּקְּדֵשִׁים.
14.english: Their soul perisheth in youth, and their life as that of the depraved.

15.hebrew: יְחַלֵּץ עָנִי בְעָנְיוֹ;    וְיִגֶל בַּלַּחַץ אָזְנָם.
15.english: He delivereth the afflicted by His affliction, and openeth their ear by tribulation.

16.hebrew: וְאַף הֲסִיתְךָ, מִפִּי-צָר--    רַחַב, לֹא-מוּצָק תַּחְתֶּיהָ;וְנַחַת שֻׁלְחָנְךָ,    מָלֵא דָשֶׁן.
16.english: Yea, He hath allured thee out of distress into a broad place, where there is no straitness; {N}and that which is set on thy table is full of fatness;

17.hebrew: וְדִין-רָשָׁע מָלֵאתָ;    דִּין וּמִשְׁפָּט יִתְמֹכוּ.
17.english: And thou art full of the judgment of the wicked; judgment and justice take hold on them.

18.hebrew: כִּי-חֵמָה, פֶּן-יְסִיתְךָ בְסָפֶק;    וְרָב-כֹּפֶר, אַל-יַטֶּךָּ.
18.english: For beware of wrath, lest thou be led away by thy sufficiency; neither let the greatness of the ransom turn thee aside.

19.hebrew: הֲיַעֲרֹךְ שׁוּעֲךָ, לֹא בְצָר;    וְכֹל, מַאֲמַצֵּי-כֹחַ.
19.english: Will thy riches avail, that are without stint, or all the forces of thy strength?

20.hebrew: אַל-תִּשְׁאַף הַלָּיְלָה--    לַעֲלוֹת עַמִּים תַּחְתָּם.
20.english: Desire not the night, when peoples are cut off in their place.

21.hebrew: הִשָּׁמֶר, אַל-תֵּפֶן אֶל-אָוֶן:    כִּי-עַל-זֶה, בָּחַרְתָּ מֵעֹנִי.
21.english: Take heed, regard not iniquity; for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.

22.hebrew: הֶן-אֵל, יַשְׂגִּיב בְּכֹחוֹ;    מִי כָמֹהוּ מוֹרֶה.
22.english: Behold, God doeth loftily in His power; who is a teacher like Him?

23.hebrew: מִי-פָקַד עָלָיו דַּרְכּוֹ;    וּמִי-אָמַר, פָּעַלְתָּ עַוְלָה.
23.english: Who hath enjoined Him His way? Or who hath said: 'Thou hast wrought unrighteousness'?

24.hebrew: זְכֹר, כִּי-תַשְׂגִּיא פָעֳלוֹ--    אֲשֶׁר שֹׁרְרוּ אֲנָשִׁים.
24.english: Remember that thou magnify His work, whereof men have sung.

25.hebrew: כָּל-אָדָם חָזוּ-בוֹ;    אֱנוֹשׁ, יַבִּיט מֵרָחוֹק.
25.english: All men have looked thereon; man beholdeth it afar off.

26.hebrew: הֶן-אֵל שַׂגִּיא, וְלֹא נֵדָע;    מִסְפַּר שָׁנָיו וְלֹא-חֵקֶר.
26.english: Behold, God is great, beyond our knowledge; the number of His years is unsearchable.

27.hebrew: כִּי, יְגָרַע נִטְפֵי-מָיִם;    יָזֹקּוּ מָטָר לְאֵדוֹ.
27.english: For He draweth away the drops of water, which distil rain from His vapour;

28.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר-יִזְּלוּ שְׁחָקִים;    יִרְעֲפוּ, עֲלֵי אָדָם רָב.
28.english: Which the skies pour down and drop upon the multitudes of men.

29.english: Yea, can any understand the spreadings of the clouds, the crashings of His pavilion?

30.hebrew: הֵן-פָּרַשׂ עָלָיו אוֹרוֹ;    וְשָׁרְשֵׁי הַיָּם כִּסָּה.
30.english: Behold, He spreadeth His light upon it; and He covereth the depths of the sea.

31.english: For by these He judgeth the peoples; He giveth food in abundance.

32.english: He covereth His hands with the lightning, and giveth it a charge that it strike the mark.

33.hebrew: יַגִּיד עָלָיו רֵעוֹ;    מִקְנֶה, אַף עַל-עוֹלֶה.
33.english: The noise thereof telleth concerning it, the cattle also concerning the storm that cometh up.

1.english: At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of its place.

2.hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ שָׁמוֹעַ בְּרֹגֶז קֹלוֹ;    וְהֶגֶה, מִפִּיו יֵצֵא.
2.english: Hear attentively the noise of His voice, and the sound that goeth out of His mouth.

3.hebrew: תַּחַת-כָּל-הַשָּׁמַיִם יִשְׁרֵהוּ;    וְאוֹרוֹ, עַל-כַּנְפוֹת הָאָרֶץ.
3.english: He sendeth it forth under the whole heaven, and His lightning unto the ends of the earth.

4.hebrew: אַחֲרָיו, יִשְׁאַג-קוֹל--    יַרְעֵם, בְּקוֹל גְּאוֹנוֹ;וְלֹא יְעַקְּבֵם,    כִּי-יִשָּׁמַע קוֹלוֹ.
4.english: After it a voice roareth; He thundereth with the voice of His majesty; {N}and He stayeth them not when His voice is heard.

5.hebrew: יַרְעֵם אֵל בְּקוֹלוֹ, נִפְלָאוֹת;    עֹשֶׂה גְדֹלוֹת, וְלֹא נֵדָע.
5.english: God thundereth marvellously with His voice; great things doeth He, which we cannot comprehend.

6.hebrew: כִּי לַשֶּׁלֶג, יֹאמַר--    הֱוֵא-אָרֶץ:וְגֶשֶׁם מָטָר;    וְגֶשֶׁם, מִטְרוֹת עֻזּוֹ.
6.english: For He saith to the snow: 'Fall thou on the earth'; {N}likewise to the shower of rain, and to the showers of His mighty rain.

7.hebrew: בְּיַד-כָּל-אָדָם יַחְתּוֹם--    לָדַעַת, כָּל-אַנְשֵׁי מַעֲשֵׂהוּ.
7.english: He sealeth up the hand of every man, that all men whom He hath made may know it.

8.hebrew: וַתָּבוֹא חַיָּה בְמוֹ-אָרֶב;    וּבִמְעוֹנֹתֶיהָ תִשְׁכֹּן.
8.english: Then the beasts go into coverts, and remain in their dens.

9.hebrew: מִן-הַחֶדֶר, תָּבוֹא סוּפָה;    וּמִמְּזָרִים קָרָה.
9.english: Out of the Chamber cometh the storm; and cold out of the north.

10.hebrew: מִנִּשְׁמַת-אֵל יִתֶּן-קָרַח;    וְרֹחַב מַיִם בְּמוּצָק.
10.english: By the breath of God ice is given, and the breadth of the waters is straitened.

11.hebrew: אַף-בְּרִי, יַטְרִיחַ עָב;    יָפִיץ, עֲנַן אוֹרוֹ.
11.english: Yea, He ladeth the thick cloud with moisture, He spreadeth abroad the cloud of His lightning;

12.hebrew: וְהוּא מְסִבּוֹת, מִתְהַפֵּךְ בְּתַחְבּוּלֹתָו    לְפָעֳלָם:כֹּל אֲשֶׁר יְצַוֵּם,    עַל-פְּנֵי תֵבֵל אָרְצָה.
12.english: And they are turned round about by His guidance, that they may do {N}whatsoever He commandeth them upon the face of the habitable world:

13.hebrew: אִם-לְשֵׁבֶט אִם-לְאַרְצוֹ--    אִם-לְחֶסֶד, יַמְצִאֵהוּ.
13.english: Whether it be for correction, or for His earth, or for mercy, that He cause it to come.

14.hebrew: הַאֲזִינָה זֹּאת אִיּוֹב;    עֲמֹד, וְהִתְבּוֹנֵן נִפְלְאוֹת אֵל.
14.english: Hearken unto this, O Job; stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.

15.hebrew: הֲתֵדַע, בְּשׂוּם-אֱלוֹהַּ עֲלֵיהֶם;    וְהֹפִיעַ, אוֹר עֲנָנוֹ.
15.english: Dost thou know how God enjoineth them, and causeth the lightning of His cloud to shine?

16.hebrew: הֲתֵדַע, עַל-מִפְלְשֵׂי-עָב;    מִפְלְאוֹת, תְּמִים דֵּעִים.
16.english: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of Him who is perfect in knowledge?

17.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר-בְּגָדֶיךָ חַמִּים--    בְּהַשְׁקִט אֶרֶץ, מִדָּרוֹם.
17.english: Thou whose garments are warm, when the earth is still by reason of the south wind;

18.hebrew: תַּרְקִיעַ עִמּוֹ, לִשְׁחָקִים;    חֲזָקִים, כִּרְאִי מוּצָק.
18.english: Canst thou with Him spread out the sky, which is strong as a molten mirror?

19.hebrew: הוֹדִיעֵנוּ, מַה-נֹּאמַר לוֹ;    לֹא-נַעֲרֹךְ, מִפְּנֵי-חֹשֶׁךְ.
19.english: Teach us what we shall say unto Him; for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.

20.hebrew: הַיְסֻפַּר-לוֹ, כִּי אֲדַבֵּר;    אִם-אָמַר אִישׁ, כִּי יְבֻלָּע.
20.english: Shall it be told Him that I would speak? Or should a man wish that he were swallowed up?

21.hebrew: וְעַתָּה, לֹא רָאוּ אוֹר--    בָּהִיר הוּא, בַּשְּׁחָקִים;וְרוּחַ עָבְרָה,    וַתְּטַהֲרֵם.
21.english: And now men see not the light which is bright in the skies; {N}but the wind passeth, and cleanseth them.

22.hebrew: מִצָּפוֹן, זָהָב יֶאֱתֶה;    עַל-אֱלוֹהַּ, נוֹרָא הוֹד.
22.english: Out of the north cometh golden splendour, about God is terrible majesty.

23.hebrew: שַׁדַּי לֹא-מְצָאנֻהוּ, שַׂגִּיא-כֹחַ;    וּמִשְׁפָּט וְרֹב-צְדָקָה, לֹא יְעַנֶּה.
23.english: The Almighty, whom we cannot find out, is excellent in power, yet to judgment and plenteous justice He doeth no violence.

24.hebrew: לָכֵן, יְרֵאוּהוּ אֲנָשִׁים;    לֹא-יִרְאֶה, כָּל-חַכְמֵי-לֵב.
24.english: Men do therefore fear Him; He regardeth not any that are wise of heart. {P}

1.english: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said:

2.hebrew: מִי זֶה, מַחְשִׁיךְ עֵצָה בְמִלִּין--    בְּלִי-דָעַת.
2.english: Who is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge?

3.hebrew: אֱזָר-נָא כְגֶבֶר חֲלָצֶיךָ;    וְאֶשְׁאָלְךָ, וְהוֹדִיעֵנִי.
3.english: Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto Me.

4.hebrew: אֵיפֹה הָיִיתָ, בְּיָסְדִי-אָרֶץ;    הַגֵּד, אִם-יָדַעְתָּ בִינָה.
4.english: Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? Declare, if thou hast the understanding.

5.hebrew: מִי-שָׂם מְמַדֶּיהָ, כִּי תֵדָע;    אוֹ מִי-נָטָה עָלֶיהָ קָּו.
5.english: Who determined the measures thereof, if thou knowest? Or who stretched the line upon it?

6.hebrew: עַל-מָה, אֲדָנֶיהָ הָטְבָּעוּ;    אוֹ מִי-יָרָה, אֶבֶן פִּנָּתָהּ.
6.english: Whereupon were the foundations thereof fastened? Or who laid the corner-stone thereof,

7.hebrew: בְּרָן-יַחַד, כּוֹכְבֵי בֹקֶר;    וַיָּרִיעוּ, כָּל-בְּנֵי אֱלֹהִים.
7.english: When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?

8.hebrew: וַיָּסֶךְ בִּדְלָתַיִם יָם;    בְּגִיחוֹ, מֵרֶחֶם יֵצֵא.
8.english: Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it broke forth, and issued out of the womb;

9.hebrew: בְּשׂוּמִי עָנָן לְבֻשׁוֹ;    וַעֲרָפֶל, חֲתֻלָּתוֹ.
9.english: When I made the cloud the garment thereof, and thick darkness a swaddlingband for it,

10.hebrew: וָאֶשְׁבֹּר עָלָיו חֻקִּי;    וָאָשִׂים, בְּרִיחַ וּדְלָתָיִם.
10.english: And prescribed for it My decree, and set bars and doors,

11.hebrew: וָאֹמַר--עַד-פֹּה תָבוֹא, וְלֹא תֹסִיף;    וּפֹא-יָשִׁית, בִּגְאוֹן גַּלֶּיךָ.
11.english: And said: 'Thus far shalt thou come, but no further; and here shall thy proud waves be stayed'?

12.hebrew: הֲמִיָּמֶיךָ, צִוִּיתָ בֹּקֶר;    ידעתה שחר (יִדַּעְתָּ הַשַּׁחַר) מְקֹמוֹ.
12.english: Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days began, and caused the dayspring to know its place;

13.hebrew: לֶאֱחֹז, בְּכַנְפוֹת הָאָרֶץ;    וְיִנָּעֲרוּ רְשָׁעִים מִמֶּנָּה.
13.english: That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, and the wicked be shaken out of it?

14.hebrew: תִּתְהַפֵּךְ, כְּחֹמֶר חוֹתָם;    וְיִתְיַצְּבוּ, כְּמוֹ לְבוּשׁ.
14.english: It is changed as clay under the seal; and they stand as a garment.

15.hebrew: וְיִמָּנַע מֵרְשָׁעִים אוֹרָם;    וּזְרוֹעַ רָמָה, תִּשָּׁבֵר.
15.english: But from the wicked their light is withholden, and the high arm is broken.

16.hebrew: הֲבָאתָ, עַד-נִבְכֵי-יָם;    וּבְחֵקֶר תְּהוֹם, הִתְהַלָּכְתָּ.
16.english: Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? Or hast thou walked in the recesses of the deep?

17.hebrew: הֲנִגְלוּ לְךָ, שַׁעֲרֵי-מָוֶת;    וְשַׁעֲרֵי צַלְמָוֶת תִּרְאֶה.
17.english: Have the gates of death been revealed unto thee? Or hast thou seen the gates of the shadow of death?

18.hebrew: הִתְבֹּנַנְתָּ, עַד-רַחֲבֵי-אָרֶץ;    הַגֵּד, אִם-יָדַעְתָּ כֻלָּהּ.
18.english: Hast thou surveyed unto the breadths of the earth? Declare, if thou knowest it all.

19.hebrew: אֵי-זֶה הַדֶּרֶךְ, יִשְׁכָּן-אוֹר;    וְחֹשֶׁךְ, אֵי-זֶה מְקֹמוֹ.
19.english: Where is the way to the dwelling of light, and as for darkness, where is the place thereof;

20.hebrew: כִּי תִקָּחֶנּוּ אֶל-גְּבוּלוֹ;    וְכִי-תָבִין, נְתִיבוֹת בֵּיתוֹ.
20.english: That thou shouldest take it to the bound thereof, and that thou shouldest know the paths to the house thereof?

21.hebrew: יָדַעְתָּ, כִּי-אָז תִּוָּלֵד;    וּמִסְפַּר יָמֶיךָ רַבִּים.
21.english: Thou knowest it, for thou wast then born, and the number of thy days is great!

22.hebrew: הֲבָאתָ, אֶל-אֹצְרוֹת שָׁלֶג;    וְאוֹצְרוֹת בָּרָד תִּרְאֶה.
22.english: Hast thou entered the treasuries of the snow, or hast thou seen the treasuries of the hail,

23.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר-חָשַׂכְתִּי לְעֶת-צָר;    לְיוֹם קְרָב, וּמִלְחָמָה.
23.english: Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?

24.hebrew: אֵי-זֶה הַדֶּרֶךְ, יֵחָלֶק אוֹר;    יָפֵץ קָדִים עֲלֵי-אָרֶץ.
24.english: By what way is the light parted, or the east wind scattered upon the earth?

25.hebrew: מִי-פִלַּג לַשֶּׁטֶף תְּעָלָה;    וְדֶרֶךְ, לַחֲזִיז קֹלוֹת.
25.english: Who hath cleft a channel for the waterflood, or a way for the lightning of the thunder;

26.hebrew: לְהַמְטִיר, עַל-אֶרֶץ לֹא-אִישׁ--    מִדְבָּר, לֹא-אָדָם בּוֹ.
26.english: To cause it to rain on a land where no man is, on the wilderness, wherein there is no man;

27.hebrew: לְהַשְׂבִּיעַ שֹׁאָה, וּמְשֹׁאָה;    וּלְהַצְמִיחַ, מֹצָא דֶשֶׁא.
27.english: To satisfy the desolate and waste ground, and to cause the bud of the tender herb to spring forth?

28.english: Hath the rain a father? Or who hath begotten the drops of dew?

29.hebrew: מִבֶּטֶן מִי, יָצָא הַקָּרַח;    וּכְפֹר שָׁמַיִם, מִי יְלָדוֹ.
29.english: Out of whose womb came the ice? And the hoar-frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?

30.hebrew: כָּאֶבֶן, מַיִם יִתְחַבָּאוּ;    וּפְנֵי תְהוֹם, יִתְלַכָּדוּ.
30.english: The waters are congealed like stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.

31.hebrew: הַתְקַשֵּׁר, מַעֲדַנּוֹת כִּימָה;    אוֹ-מֹשְׁכוֹת כְּסִיל תְּפַתֵּחַ.
31.english: Canst thou bind the chains of the Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?

32.hebrew: הֲתֹצִיא מַזָּרוֹת בְּעִתּוֹ;    וְעַיִשׁ, עַל-בָּנֶיהָ תַנְחֵם.
32.english: Canst thou lead forth the Mazzaroth in their season? Or canst thou guide the Bear with her sons?

33.hebrew: הֲיָדַעְתָּ, חֻקּוֹת שָׁמָיִם;    אִם-תָּשִׂים מִשְׁטָרוֹ בָאָרֶץ.
33.english: Knowest thou the ordinances of the heavens? Canst thou establish the dominion thereof in the earth?

34.english: Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?

35.hebrew: הַתְשַׁלַּח בְּרָקִים וְיֵלֵכוּ;    וְיֹאמְרוּ לְךָ הִנֵּנוּ.
35.english: Canst thou send forth lightnings, that they may go, and say unto thee: 'Here we are'?

36.hebrew: מִי-שָׁת, בַּטֻּחוֹת חָכְמָה;    אוֹ מִי-נָתַן לַשֶּׂכְוִי בִינָה.
36.english: Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts? Or who hath given understanding to the mind?

37.hebrew: מִי-יְסַפֵּר שְׁחָקִים בְּחָכְמָה;    וְנִבְלֵי שָׁמַיִם, מִי יַשְׁכִּיב.
37.english: Who can number the clouds by wisdom? Or who can pour out the bottles of heaven,

38.english: When the dust runneth into a mass, and the clods cleave fast together?

39.hebrew: הֲתָצוּד לְלָבִיא טָרֶף;    וְחַיַּת כְּפִירִים תְּמַלֵּא.
39.english: Wilt thou hunt the prey for the lioness? Or satisfy the appetite of the young lions,

40.english: When they couch in their dens, and abide in the covert to lie in wait?

41.hebrew: מִי יָכִין לָעֹרֵב,    צֵידוֹ:כִּי-יְלָדָו, אֶל-אֵל יְשַׁוֵּעוּ;    יִתְעוּ, לִבְלִי-אֹכֶל.
41.english: Who provideth for the raven his prey, {N}when his young ones cry unto God, and wander for lack of food?

1.hebrew: הֲיָדַעְתָּ--עֵת, לֶדֶת יַעֲלֵי-סָלַע;    חֹלֵל אַיָּלוֹת תִּשְׁמֹר.
1.english: Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? Or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve?

2.hebrew: תִּסְפֹּר יְרָחִים תְּמַלֶּאנָה;    וְיָדַעְתָּ, עֵת לִדְתָּנָה.
2.english: Canst thou number the months that they fulfil? Or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?

3.hebrew: תִּכְרַעְנָה, יַלְדֵיהֶן תְּפַלַּחְנָה;    חֶבְלֵיהֶם תְּשַׁלַּחְנָה.
3.english: They bow themselves, they bring forth their young, they cast out their fruit.

4.hebrew: יַחְלְמוּ בְנֵיהֶם, יִרְבּוּ בַבָּר;    יָצְאוּ, וְלֹא-שָׁבוּ לָמוֹ.
4.english: Their young ones wax strong, they grow up in the open field; they go forth, and return not again.

5.hebrew: מִי-שִׁלַּח פֶּרֶא חָפְשִׁי;    וּמֹסְרוֹת עָרוֹד, מִי פִתֵּחַ.
5.english: Who hath sent out the wild ass free? Or who hath loosed the bands of the wild ass?

6.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר-שַׂמְתִּי עֲרָבָה בֵיתוֹ;    וּמִשְׁכְּנוֹתָיו מְלֵחָה.
6.english: Whose house I have made the wilderness, and the salt land his dwelling-place.

7.hebrew: יִשְׂחַק, לַהֲמוֹן קִרְיָה;    תְּשֻׁאוֹת נֹגֵשׂ, לֹא יִשְׁמָע.
7.english: He scorneth the tumult of the city, neither heareth he the shoutings of the driver.

8.hebrew: יְתוּר הָרִים מִרְעֵהוּ;    וְאַחַר כָּל-יָרוֹק יִדְרוֹשׁ.
8.english: The range of the mountains is his pasture, and he searcheth after every green thing.

9.hebrew: הֲיֹאבֶה רֵּים עָבְדֶךָ;    אִם-יָלִין, עַל-אֲבוּסֶךָ.
9.english: Will the wild-ox be willing to serve thee? Or will he abide by thy crib?

10.hebrew: הֲתִקְשָׁר-רֵים, בְּתֶלֶם עֲבֹתוֹ;    אִם-יְשַׂדֵּד עֲמָקִים אַחֲרֶיךָ.
10.english: Canst thou bind the wild-ox with his band in the furrow? Or will he harrow the valleys after thee?

11.hebrew: הֲתִבְטַח-בּוֹ, כִּי-רַב כֹּחוֹ;    וְתַעֲזֹב אֵלָיו יְגִיעֶךָ.
11.english: Wilt thou trust him, because his strength is great? Or wilt thou leave thy labour to him?

12.hebrew: הֲתַאֲמִין בּוֹ, כִּי-ישוב (יָשִׁיב) זַרְעֶךָ;    וְגָרְנְךָ יֶאֱסֹף.
12.english: Wilt thou rely on him, that he will bring home thy seed, and gather the corn of thy threshing-floor?

13.hebrew: כְּנַף-רְנָנִים נֶעֱלָסָה;    אִם-אֶבְרָה, חֲסִידָה וְנֹצָה.
13.english: The wing of the ostrich beateth joyously; but are her pinions and feathers the kindly stork's?

14.hebrew: כִּי-תַעֲזֹב לָאָרֶץ בֵּצֶיהָ;    וְעַל-עָפָר תְּחַמֵּם.
14.english: For she leaveth her eggs on the earth, and warmeth them in dust,

15.hebrew: וַתִּשְׁכַּח, כִּי-רֶגֶל תְּזוּרֶהָ;    וְחַיַּת הַשָּׂדֶה תְדוּשֶׁהָ.
15.english: And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, or that the wild beast may trample them.

16.hebrew: הִקְשִׁיחַ בָּנֶיהָ לְּלֹא-לָהּ;    לְרִיק יְגִיעָהּ בְּלִי-פָחַד.
16.english: She is hardened against her young ones, as if they were not hers; though her labour be in vain, she is without fear;

17.hebrew: כִּי-הִשָּׁהּ אֱלוֹהַּ חָכְמָה;    וְלֹא-חָלַק לָהּ, בַּבִּינָה.
17.english: Because God hath deprived her of wisdom, neither hath He imparted to her understanding.

18.hebrew: כָּעֵת, בַּמָּרוֹם תַּמְרִיא;    תִּשְׂחַק לַסּוּס, וּלְרֹכְבוֹ.
18.english: When the time cometh, she raiseth her wings on high, and scorneth the horse and his rider. {P}

19.hebrew: הֲתִתֵּן לַסּוּס גְּבוּרָה;    הֲתַלְבִּישׁ צַוָּארוֹ רַעְמָה.
19.english: Hast thou given the horse his strength? Hast thou clothed his neck with fierceness?

20.hebrew: הֲתַרְעִישֶׁנּוּ, כָּאַרְבֶּה;    הוֹד נַחְרוֹ אֵימָה.
20.english: Hast thou made him to leap as a locust? The glory of his snorting is terrible.

21.hebrew: יַחְפְּרוּ בָעֵמֶק, וְיָשִׂישׂ בְּכֹחַ;    יֵצֵא, לִקְרַאת-נָשֶׁק.
21.english: He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in his strength; he goeth out to meet the clash of arms.

22.hebrew: יִשְׂחַק לְפַחַד, וְלֹא יֵחָת;    וְלֹא-יָשׁוּב, מִפְּנֵי-חָרֶב.
22.english: He mocketh at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turneth he back from the sword.

23.hebrew: עָלָיו, תִּרְנֶה אַשְׁפָּה;    לַהַב חֲנִית וְכִידוֹן.
23.english: The quiver rattleth upon him, the glittering spear and the javelin.

24.hebrew: בְּרַעַשׁ וְרֹגֶז, יְגַמֶּא-אָרֶץ;    וְלֹא-יַאֲמִין, כִּי-קוֹל שׁוֹפָר.
24.english: He swalloweth the ground with storm and rage; neither believeth he that it is the voice of the horn.

25.hebrew: בְּדֵי שֹׁפָר, יֹאמַר הֶאָח--    וּמֵרָחוֹק, יָרִיחַ מִלְחָמָה;רַעַם שָׂרִים,    וּתְרוּעָה.
25.english: As oft as he heareth the horn he saith: 'Ha, ha!' and he smelleth the battle afar off, {N}the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.

26.hebrew: הֲמִבִּינָתְךָ, יַאֲבֶר-נֵץ;    יִפְרֹשׂ כְּנָפָו לְתֵימָן.
26.english: Doth the hawk soar by thy wisdom, and stretch her wings toward the south?

27.hebrew: אִם-עַל-פִּיךָ, יַגְבִּיהַּ נָשֶׁר;    וְכִי, יָרִים קִנּוֹ.
27.english: Doth the vulture mount up at thy command, and make her nest on high?

28.hebrew: סֶלַע יִשְׁכֹּן, וְיִתְלֹנָן--    עַל שֶׁן-סֶלַע, וּמְצוּדָה.
28.english: She dwelleth and abideth on the rock, upon the crag of the rock, and the stronghold.

29.english: From thence she spieth out the prey; her eyes behold it afar off.

30.hebrew: וְאֶפְרֹחָו יְעַלְעוּ-דָם;    וּבַאֲשֶׁר חֲלָלִים, שָׁם הוּא.
30.english: Her young ones also suck up blood; and where the slain are, there is she.

1.english: {S} Moreover the LORD answered Job, and said:

2.hebrew: הֲרֹב, עִם-שַׁדַּי יִסּוֹר;    מוֹכִיחַ אֱלוֹהַּ יַעֲנֶנָּה.
2.english: Shall he that reproveth contend with the Almighty? He that argueth with God, let him answer it. {P}

3.hebrew: וַיַּעַן אִיּוֹב אֶת-יְהוָה; וַיֹּאמַר.
3.english: {S} Then Job answered the LORD, and said:

4.hebrew: הֵן קַלֹּתִי, מָה אֲשִׁיבֶךָּ;    יָדִי, שַׂמְתִּי לְמוֹ-פִי.
4.english: Behold, I am of small account; what shall I answer Thee? I lay my hand upon my mouth.

5.hebrew: אַחַת דִּבַּרְתִּי, וְלֹא אֶעֱנֶה;    וּשְׁתַּיִם, וְלֹא אוֹסִיף.
5.english: Once have I spoken, but I will not answer again; yea, twice, but I will proceed no further. {P}

6.hebrew: וַיַּעַן-יְהוָה אֶת-אִיּוֹב, מנסערה (מִן סְעָרָה);    וַיֹּאמַר.
6.english: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said:

7.hebrew: אֱזָר-נָא כְגֶבֶר חֲלָצֶיךָ;    אֶשְׁאָלְךָ, וְהוֹדִיעֵנִי.
7.english: Gird up thy loins now like a man; I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto Me.

8.hebrew: הַאַף, תָּפֵר מִשְׁפָּטִי;    תַּרְשִׁיעֵנִי, לְמַעַן תִּצְדָּק.
8.english: Wilt thou even make void My judgment? Wilt thou condemn Me, that thou mayest be justified?

9.hebrew: וְאִם-זְרוֹעַ כָּאֵל לָךְ;    וּבְקוֹל, כָּמֹהוּ תַרְעֵם.
9.english: Or hast thou an arm like God? And canst thou thunder with a voice like Him?

10.hebrew: עֲדֵה נָא גָאוֹן וָגֹבַהּ;    וְהוֹד וְהָדָר תִּלְבָּשׁ.
10.english: Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency, and array thyself with glory and beauty.

11.hebrew: הָפֵץ, עֶבְרוֹת אַפֶּךָ;    וּרְאֵה כָל-גֵּאֶה, וְהַשְׁפִּילֵהוּ.
11.english: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath; and look upon every one that is proud, and abase him.

12.hebrew: רְאֵה כָל-גֵּאֶה, הַכְנִיעֵהוּ;    וַהֲדֹךְ רְשָׁעִים תַּחְתָּם.
12.english: Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.

13.hebrew: טָמְנֵם בֶּעָפָר יָחַד;    פְּנֵיהֶם, חֲבֹשׁ בַּטָּמוּן.
13.english: Hide them in the dust together; bind their faces in the hidden place.

14.hebrew: וְגַם-אֲנִי אוֹדֶךָּ:    כִּי-תוֹשִׁעַ לְךָ יְמִינֶךָ.
14.english: Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.

15.hebrew: הִנֵּה-נָא בְהֵמוֹת, אֲשֶׁר-עָשִׂיתִי עִמָּךְ;    חָצִיר, כַּבָּקָר יֹאכֵל.
15.english: Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.

16.hebrew: הִנֵּה-נָא כֹחוֹ בְמָתְנָיו;    וְאוֹנוֹ, בִּשְׁרִירֵי בִטְנוֹ.
16.english: Lo now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the stays of his body.

17.hebrew: יַחְפֹּץ זְנָבוֹ כְמוֹ-אָרֶז;    גִּידֵי פַחֲדָו יְשֹׂרָגוּ.
17.english: He straineth his tail like a cedar; the sinews of his thighs are knit together.

18.hebrew: עֲצָמָיו, אֲפִיקֵי נְחֻשָׁה;    גְּרָמָיו, כִּמְטִיל בַּרְזֶל.
18.english: His bones are as pipes of brass; his gristles are like bars of iron.

19.hebrew: הוּא, רֵאשִׁית דַּרְכֵי-אֵל;    הָעֹשׂוֹ, יַגֵּשׁ חַרְבּוֹ.
19.english: He is the beginning of the ways of God; He only that made him can make His sword to approach unto him.

20.hebrew: כִּי-בוּל, הָרִים יִשְׂאוּ-לוֹ;    וְכָל-חַיַּת הַשָּׂדֶה, יְשַׂחֲקוּ-שָׁם.
20.english: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, and all the beasts of the field play there.

21.hebrew: תַּחַת-צֶאֱלִים יִשְׁכָּב--    בְּסֵתֶר קָנֶה וּבִצָּה.
21.english: He lieth under the lotus-trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.

22.hebrew: יְסֻכֻּהוּ צֶאֱלִים צִלְלוֹ;    יְסֻבּוּהוּ, עַרְבֵי-נָחַל.
22.english: The lotus-trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.

23.hebrew: הֵן יַעֲשֹׁק נָהָר, לֹא יַחְפּוֹז;    יִבְטַח, כִּי-יָגִיחַ יַרְדֵּן אֶל-פִּיהוּ.
23.english: Behold, if a river overflow, he trembleth not; he is confident, though the Jordan rush forth to his mouth.

24.hebrew: בְּעֵינָיו יִקָּחֶנּוּ;    בְּמוֹקְשִׁים, יִנְקָב-אָף.
24.english: Shall any take him by his eyes, or pierce through his nose with a snare?

25.hebrew: תִּמְשֹׁךְ לִוְיָתָן בְּחַכָּה;    וּבְחֶבֶל, תַּשְׁקִיעַ לְשֹׁנוֹ.
25.english: Canst thou draw out leviathan with a fish-hook? or press down his tongue with a cord?

26.hebrew: הֲתָשִׂים אַגְמֹן בְּאַפּוֹ;    וּבְחוֹחַ, תִּקֹּב לֶחֱיוֹ.
26.english: Canst thou put a ring into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a hook?

27.hebrew: הֲיַרְבֶּה אֵלֶיךָ, תַּחֲנוּנִים;    אִם-יְדַבֵּר אֵלֶיךָ רַכּוֹת.
27.english: Will he make many supplications unto thee? or will he speak soft words unto thee?

28.hebrew: הֲיִכְרֹת בְּרִית עִמָּךְ;    תִּקָּחֶנּוּ, לְעֶבֶד עוֹלָם.
28.english: Will he make a covenant with thee, that thou shouldest take him for a servant for ever?

29.english: Wilt thou play with him as with a bird? Or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?

30.hebrew: יִכְרוּ עָלָיו, חַבָּרִים;    יֶחֱצוּהוּ, בֵּין כְּנַעֲנִים.
30.english: Will the bands of fishermen make a banquet of him? Will they part him among the merchants?

31.hebrew: הַתְמַלֵּא בְשֻׂכּוֹת עוֹרוֹ;    וּבְצִלְצַל דָּגִים רֹאשׁוֹ.
31.english: Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish-spears?

32.english: Lay thy hand upon him; think upon the battle, thou wilt do so no more.

1.english: Behold, the hope of him is in vain; shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?

2.hebrew: לֹא-אַכְזָר, כִּי יְעוּרֶנּוּ;    וּמִי הוּא, לְפָנַי יִתְיַצָּב.
2.english: None is so fierce that dare stir him up; who then is able to stand before Me?

3.hebrew: מִי הִקְדִּימַנִי, וַאֲשַׁלֵּם;    תַּחַת כָּל-הַשָּׁמַיִם לִי-הוּא.
3.english: Who hath given Me anything beforehand, that I should repay him? Whatsoever is under the whole heaven is Mine.

4.hebrew: לא- (לוֹ-) אַחֲרִישׁ בַּדָּיו;    וּדְבַר-גְּבוּרוֹת, וְחִין עֶרְכּוֹ.
4.english: Would I keep silence concerning his boastings, or his proud talk, or his fair array of words?

5.hebrew: מִי-גִלָּה, פְּנֵי לְבוּשׁוֹ;    בְּכֶפֶל רִסְנוֹ, מִי יָבוֹא.
5.english: Who can uncover the face of his garment? Who shall come within his double bridle?

6.hebrew: דַּלְתֵי פָנָיו, מִי פִתֵּחַ;    סְבִיבוֹת שִׁנָּיו אֵימָה.
6.english: Who can open the doors of his face? Round about his teeth is terror.

7.hebrew: גַּאֲוָה, אֲפִיקֵי מָגִנִּים;    סָגוּר, חוֹתָם צָר.
7.english: His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.

8.hebrew: אֶחָד בְּאֶחָד יִגַּשׁוּ;    וְרוּחַ, לֹא-יָבֹא בֵינֵיהֶם.
8.english: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.

9.hebrew: אִישׁ-בְּאָחִיהוּ יְדֻבָּקוּ;    יִתְלַכְּדוּ, וְלֹא יִתְפָּרָדוּ.
9.english: They are joined one to another; they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.

10.hebrew: עֲטִישֹׁתָיו, תָּהֶל אוֹר;    וְעֵינָיו, כְּעַפְעַפֵּי-שָׁחַר.
10.english: His sneezings flash forth light, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.

11.hebrew: מִפִּיו, לַפִּידִים יַהֲלֹכוּ;    כִּידוֹדֵי אֵשׁ, יִתְמַלָּטוּ.
11.english: Out of his mouth go burning torches, and sparks of fire leap forth.

12.hebrew: מִנְּחִירָיו, יֵצֵא עָשָׁן--    כְּדוּד נָפוּחַ וְאַגְמֹן.
12.english: Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot and burning rushes.

13.hebrew: נַפְשׁוֹ, גֶּחָלִים תְּלַהֵט;    וְלַהַב, מִפִּיו יֵצֵא.
13.english: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.

14.hebrew: בְּצַוָּארוֹ, יָלִין עֹז;    וּלְפָנָיו, תָּדוּץ דְּאָבָה.
14.english: In his neck abideth strength, and dismay danceth before him.

15.hebrew: מַפְּלֵי בְשָׂרוֹ דָבֵקוּ;    יָצוּק עָלָיו, בַּל-יִמּוֹט.
15.english: The flakes of his flesh are joined together; they are firm upon him; they cannot be moved.

16.hebrew: לִבּוֹ, יָצוּק כְּמוֹ-אָבֶן;    וְיָצוּק, כְּפֶלַח תַּחְתִּית.
16.english: His heart is as firm as a stone; yea, firm as the nether millstone.

17.hebrew: מִשֵּׂתוֹ, יָגוּרוּ אֵלִים;    מִשְּׁבָרִים, יִתְחַטָּאוּ.
17.english: When he raiseth himself up, the mighty are afraid; by reason of despair they are beside themselves.

18.hebrew: מַשִּׂיגֵהוּ חֶרֶב, בְּלִי תָקוּם;    חֲנִית מַסָּע וְשִׁרְיָה.
18.english: If one lay at him with the sword, it will not hold; nor the spear, the dart, nor the pointed shaft.

19.hebrew: יַחְשֹׁב לְתֶבֶן בַּרְזֶל;    לְעֵץ רִקָּבוֹן נְחוּשָׁה.
19.english: He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.

20.hebrew: לֹא-יַבְרִיחֶנּוּ בֶן-קָשֶׁת;    לְקַשׁ, נֶהְפְּכוּ-לוֹ אַבְנֵי-קָלַע.
20.english: The arrow cannot make him flee; slingstones are turned with him into stubble.

21.hebrew: כְּקַשׁ, נֶחְשְׁבוּ תוֹתָח;    וְיִשְׂחַק, לְרַעַשׁ כִּידוֹן.
21.english: Clubs are accounted as stubble; he laugheth at the rattling of the javelin.

22.hebrew: תַּחְתָּיו, חַדּוּדֵי חָרֶשׂ;    יִרְפַּד חָרוּץ עֲלֵי-טִיט.
22.english: Sharpest potsherds are under him; he spreadeth a threshing-sledge upon the mire.

23.hebrew: יַרְתִּיחַ כַּסִּיר מְצוּלָה;    יָם, יָשִׂים כַּמֶּרְקָחָה.
23.english: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot; he maketh the sea like a seething mixture.

24.hebrew: אַחֲרָיו, יָאִיר נָתִיב;    יַחְשֹׁב תְּהוֹם לְשֵׂיבָה.
24.english: He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.

25.hebrew: אֵין-עַל-עָפָר מָשְׁלוֹ;    הֶעָשׂוּ, לִבְלִי-חָת.
25.english: Upon earth there is not his like, who is made to be fearless.

26.hebrew: אֵת-כָּל-גָּבֹהַּ יִרְאֶה;    הוּא, מֶלֶךְ עַל-כָּל-בְּנֵי-שָׁחַץ.
26.english: He looketh at all high things; he is king over all the proud beasts. {P}

1.english: {S} Then Job answered the LORD, and said:

2.hebrew: ידעת (יָדַעְתִּי), כִּי-כֹל תּוּכָל;    וְלֹא-יִבָּצֵר מִמְּךָ מְזִמָּה.
2.english: I know that Thou canst do every thing, and that no purpose can be withholden from Thee.

3.hebrew: מִי זֶה, מַעְלִים עֵצָה--    בְּלִי-דָעַת:לָכֵן הִגַּדְתִּי, וְלֹא אָבִין;    נִפְלָאוֹת מִמֶּנִּי, וְלֹא אֵדָע.
3.english: Who is this that hideth counsel without knowledge? {N}Therefore have I uttered that which I understood not, things too wonderful for me, which I knew not.

4.hebrew: שְׁמַע-נָא, וְאָנֹכִי אֲדַבֵּר;    אֶשְׁאָלְךָ, וְהוֹדִיעֵנִי.
4.english: Hear, I beseech Thee, and I will speak; I will demand of Thee, and declare Thou unto me.

5.hebrew: לְשֵׁמַע-אֹזֶן שְׁמַעְתִּיךָ;    וְעַתָּה, עֵינִי רָאָתְךָ.
5.english: I had heard of Thee by the hearing of the ear; but now mine eye seeth Thee;

6.hebrew: עַל-כֵּן, אֶמְאַס וְנִחַמְתִּי--    עַל-עָפָר וָאֵפֶר.
6.english: Wherefore I abhor my words, and repent, seeing I am dust and ashes. {P}

7.hebrew: וַיְהִי, אַחַר דִּבֶּר יְהוָה אֶת-הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה--אֶל-אִיּוֹב; וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה אֶל-אֱלִיפַז הַתֵּימָנִי, חָרָה אַפִּי בְךָ וּבִשְׁנֵי רֵעֶיךָ--כִּי לֹא דִבַּרְתֶּם אֵלַי נְכוֹנָה, כְּעַבְדִּי אִיּוֹב.  {ס}
7.english: And it was so, that after the LORD had spoken these words unto Job, the LORD said to Eliphaz the Temanite: 'My wrath is kindled against thee, and against thy two friends; for ye have not spoken of Me the thing that is right, as My servant Job hath. {S}

8.hebrew: וְעַתָּה קְחוּ-לָכֶם שִׁבְעָה-פָרִים וְשִׁבְעָה אֵילִים וּלְכוּ אֶל-עַבְדִּי אִיּוֹב, וְהַעֲלִיתֶם עוֹלָה בַּעַדְכֶם, וְאִיּוֹב עַבְדִּי, יִתְפַּלֵּל עֲלֵיכֶם:  כִּי אִם-פָּנָיו אֶשָּׂא, לְבִלְתִּי עֲשׂוֹת עִמָּכֶם נְבָלָה--כִּי לֹא דִבַּרְתֶּם אֵלַי נְכוֹנָה, כְּעַבְדִּי אִיּוֹב.
8.english: Now therefore, take unto you seven bullocks and seven rams, and go to My servant Job, and offer up for yourselves a burnt-offering; and My servant Job shall pray for you; for him will I accept, that I do not unto you aught unseemly; for ye have not spoken of Me the thing that is right, as my servant Job hath.'

9.hebrew: וַיֵּלְכוּ אֱלִיפַז הַתֵּימָנִי וּבִלְדַּד הַשּׁוּחִי, צֹפַר הַנַּעֲמָתִי, וַיַּעֲשׂוּ, כַּאֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר אֲלֵיהֶם יְהוָה; וַיִּשָּׂא יְהוָה, אֶת-פְּנֵי אִיּוֹב.
9.english: So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went, and did according as the LORD commanded them; and the LORD accepted Job.

10.hebrew: וַיהוָה, שָׁב אֶת-שבית (שְׁבוּת) אִיּוֹב, בְּהִתְפַּלְלוֹ, בְּעַד רֵעֵהוּ; וַיֹּסֶף יְהוָה אֶת-כָּל-אֲשֶׁר לְאִיּוֹב, לְמִשְׁנֶה.
10.english: And the LORD changed the fortune of Job, when he prayed for his friends; and the LORD gave Job twice as much as he had before.

11.hebrew: וַיָּבֹאוּ אֵלָיו כָּל-אֶחָיו וְכָל-אַחְיֹתָיו וְכָל-יֹדְעָיו לְפָנִים, וַיֹּאכְלוּ עִמּוֹ לֶחֶם בְּבֵיתוֹ, וַיָּנֻדוּ לוֹ וַיְנַחֲמוּ אֹתוֹ, עַל כָּל-הָרָעָה אֲשֶׁר-הֵבִיא יְהוָה עָלָיו; וַיִּתְּנוּ-לוֹ, אִישׁ קְשִׂיטָה אֶחָת, וְאִישׁ, נֶזֶם זָהָב אֶחָד.
11.english: Then came there unto him all his brethren, and all his sisters, and all they that had been of his acquaintance before, and did eat bread with him in his house; and they bemoaned him, and comforted him concerning all the evil that the LORD had brought upon him; every man also gave him a piece of money, and every one a ring of gold.

12.hebrew: וַיהוָה, בֵּרַךְ אֶת-אַחֲרִית אִיּוֹב--מֵרֵאשִׁתוֹ; וַיְהִי-לוֹ אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר אֶלֶף צֹאן, וְשֵׁשֶׁת אֲלָפִים גְּמַלִּים, וְאֶלֶף-צֶמֶד בָּקָר, וְאֶלֶף אֲתוֹנוֹת.
12.english: So the LORD blessed the latter end of Job more than his beginning; and he had fourteen thousand sheep, and six thousand camels, and a thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand she-asses.

13.hebrew: וַיְהִי-לוֹ שִׁבְעָנָה בָנִים, וְשָׁלוֹשׁ בָּנוֹת.
13.english: He had also seven sons and three daughters.

14.hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא שֵׁם-הָאַחַת יְמִימָה, וְשֵׁם הַשֵּׁנִית קְצִיעָה; וְשֵׁם הַשְּׁלִישִׁית, קֶרֶן הַפּוּךְ.
14.english: And he called the name of the first, Jemimah; and the name of the second, Keziah; and the name of the third, Keren-happuch.

15.hebrew: וְלֹא נִמְצָא נָשִׁים יָפוֹת, כִּבְנוֹת אִיּוֹב--בְּכָל-הָאָרֶץ; וַיִּתֵּן לָהֶם אֲבִיהֶם נַחֲלָה, בְּתוֹךְ אֲחֵיהֶם.
15.english: And in all the land were no women found so fair as the daughters of Job; and their father gave them inheritance among their brethren.

16.hebrew: וַיְחִי אִיּוֹב אַחֲרֵי-זֹאת, מֵאָה וְאַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה; וירא (וַיִּרְאֶה), אֶת-בָּנָיו וְאֶת-בְּנֵי בָנָיו--אַרְבָּעָה, דֹּרוֹת.
16.english: And after this Job lived a hundred and forty years, and saw his sons, and his sons' sons, even four generations.

17.hebrew: וַיָּמָת אִיּוֹב, זָקֵן וּשְׂבַע יָמִים.  {ש}
17.english: So Job died, being old and full of days. {P}

1.hebrew: אִישׁ הָיָה בְאֶרֶץ-עוּץ, אִיּוֹב שְׁמוֹ; וְהָיָה הָאִישׁ הַהוּא, תָּם וְיָשָׁר וִירֵא אֱלֹהִים--וְסָר מֵרָע.
1.english: There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job; and that man was whole-hearted and upright, and one that feared God, and shunned evil.

2.hebrew: וַיִּוָּלְדוּ לוֹ שִׁבְעָה בָנִים, וְשָׁלוֹשׁ בָּנוֹת.
2.english: And there were born unto him seven sons and three daughters.

3.hebrew: וַיְהִי מִקְנֵהוּ שִׁבְעַת אַלְפֵי-צֹאן וּשְׁלֹשֶׁת אַלְפֵי גְמַלִּים, וַחֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת צֶמֶד-בָּקָר וַחֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת אֲתוֹנוֹת, וַעֲבֻדָּה, רַבָּה מְאֹד; וַיְהִי הָאִישׁ הַהוּא, גָּדוֹל מִכָּל-בְּנֵי-קֶדֶם.
3.english: His possessions also were seven thousand sheep, and three thousand camels, and five hundred yoke of oxen, and five hundred she-asses, and a very great household; so that this man was the greatest of all the children of the east.

4.hebrew: וְהָלְכוּ בָנָיו וְעָשׂוּ מִשְׁתֶּה, בֵּית אִישׁ יוֹמוֹ; וְשָׁלְחוּ, וְקָרְאוּ לִשְׁלֹשֶׁת אַחְיֹתֵיהֶם, לֶאֱכֹל וְלִשְׁתּוֹת, עִמָּהֶם.
4.english: And his sons used to go and hold a feast in the house of each one upon his day; and they would send and invite their three sisters to eat and to drink with them.

5.hebrew: וַיְהִי כִּי הִקִּיפוּ יְמֵי הַמִּשְׁתֶּה וַיִּשְׁלַח אִיּוֹב וַיְקַדְּשֵׁם, וְהִשְׁכִּים בַּבֹּקֶר וְהֶעֱלָה עֹלוֹת מִסְפַּר כֻּלָּם--כִּי אָמַר אִיּוֹב, אוּלַי חָטְאוּ בָנַי וּבֵרְכוּ אֱלֹהִים בִּלְבָבָם:  כָּכָה יַעֲשֶׂה אִיּוֹב, כָּל-הַיָּמִים.  {פ}
5.english: And it was so, when the days of their feasting were gone about, that Job sent and sanctified them, and rose up early in the morning, and offered burnt-offerings according to the number of them all; for Job said: 'It may be that my sons have sinned, and blasphemed God in their hearts.' Thus did Job continually. {P}

6.hebrew: וַיְהִי הַיּוֹם--וַיָּבֹאוּ בְּנֵי הָאֱלֹהִים, לְהִתְיַצֵּב עַל-יְהוָה; וַיָּבוֹא גַם-הַשָּׂטָן, בְּתוֹכָם.
6.english: Now it fell upon a day, that the sons of God came to present themselves before the LORD, and Satan came also among them.

7.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה אֶל-הַשָּׂטָן, מֵאַיִן תָּבֹא; וַיַּעַן הַשָּׂטָן אֶת-יְהוָה, וַיֹּאמַר, מִשּׁוּט בָּאָרֶץ, וּמֵהִתְהַלֵּךְ בָּהּ.
7.english: And the LORD said unto Satan: 'Whence comest thou?' Then Satan answered the LORD, and said: 'From going to and fro in the earth, and from walking up and down in it.'

8.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה אֶל-הַשָּׂטָן, הֲשַׂמְתָּ לִבְּךָ עַל-עַבְדִּי אִיּוֹב:  כִּי אֵין כָּמֹהוּ בָּאָרֶץ, אִישׁ תָּם וְיָשָׁר יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים וְסָר מֵרָע.
8.english: And the LORD said unto Satan: 'Hast thou considered My servant Job, that there is none like him in the earth, a whole-hearted and an upright man, one that feareth God, and shunneth evil?'

9.hebrew: וַיַּעַן הַשָּׂטָן אֶת-יְהוָה, וַיֹּאמַר:  הַחִנָּם, יָרֵא אִיּוֹב אֱלֹהִים.
9.english: Then Satan answered the LORD, and said: 'Doth Job fear God for nought?

10.hebrew: הֲלֹא-את (אַתָּה) שַׂכְתָּ בַעֲדוֹ וּבְעַד-בֵּיתוֹ, וּבְעַד כָּל-אֲשֶׁר-לוֹ--מִסָּבִיב:  מַעֲשֵׂה יָדָיו בֵּרַכְתָּ, וּמִקְנֵהוּ פָּרַץ בָּאָרֶץ.
10.english: Hast not Thou made a hedge about him, and about his house, and about all that he hath, on every side? Thou hast blessed the work of his hands, and his possessions are increased in the land.

11.hebrew: וְאוּלָם שְׁלַח-נָא יָדְךָ, וְגַע בְּכָל-אֲשֶׁר-לוֹ--אִם-לֹא עַל-פָּנֶיךָ, יְבָרְכֶךָּ.
11.english: But put forth Thy hand now, and touch all that he hath, surely he will blaspheme Thee to Thy face.'

12.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה אֶל-הַשָּׂטָן, הִנֵּה כָל-אֲשֶׁר-לוֹ בְּיָדֶךָ--רַק אֵלָיו, אַל-תִּשְׁלַח יָדֶךָ; וַיֵּצֵא, הַשָּׂטָן, מֵעִם, פְּנֵי יְהוָה.
12.english: And the LORD said unto Satan: 'Behold, all that he hath is in thy power; only upon himself put not forth thy hand.' So Satan went forth from the presence of the LORD.

13.hebrew: וַיְהִי, הַיּוֹם; וּבָנָיו וּבְנֹתָיו אֹכְלִים וְשֹׁתִים יַיִן, בְּבֵית אֲחִיהֶם הַבְּכוֹר.
13.english: And it fell on a day when his sons and his daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother's house,

14.hebrew: וּמַלְאָךְ בָּא אֶל-אִיּוֹב, וַיֹּאמַר:  הַבָּקָר הָיוּ חֹרְשׁוֹת, וְהָאֲתֹנוֹת רֹעוֹת עַל-יְדֵיהֶם.
14.english: that there came a messenger unto Job, and said: 'The oxen were plowing, and the asses feeding beside them;

15.hebrew: וַתִּפֹּל שְׁבָא וַתִּקָּחֵם, וְאֶת-הַנְּעָרִים הִכּוּ לְפִי-חָרֶב; וָאִמָּלְטָה רַק-אֲנִי לְבַדִּי, לְהַגִּיד לָךְ.
15.english: and the Sabeans made a raid, and took them away; yea, they have slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.'

16.hebrew: עוֹד זֶה מְדַבֵּר, וְזֶה בָּא וַיֹּאמַר, אֵשׁ אֱלֹהִים נָפְלָה מִן-הַשָּׁמַיִם, וַתִּבְעַר בַּצֹּאן וּבַנְּעָרִים וַתֹּאכְלֵם; וָאִמָּלְטָה רַק-אֲנִי לְבַדִּי, לְהַגִּיד לָךְ.
16.english: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said: 'A fire of God is fallen from heaven, and hath burned up the sheep, and the servants, and consumed them; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.'

17.hebrew: עוֹד זֶה מְדַבֵּר, וְזֶה בָּא וַיֹּאמַר, כַּשְׂדִּים שָׂמוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה רָאשִׁים וַיִּפְשְׁטוּ עַל-הַגְּמַלִּים וַיִּקָּחוּם, וְאֶת-הַנְּעָרִים הִכּוּ לְפִי-חָרֶב; וָאִמָּלְטָה רַק-אֲנִי לְבַדִּי, לְהַגִּיד לָךְ.
17.english: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said: 'The Chaldeans set themselves in three bands, and fell upon the camels, and have taken them away, yea, and slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.'

18.hebrew: עַד זֶה מְדַבֵּר, וְזֶה בָּא וַיֹּאמַר:  בָּנֶיךָ וּבְנוֹתֶיךָ אֹכְלִים וְשֹׁתִים יַיִן, בְּבֵית אֲחִיהֶם הַבְּכוֹר.
18.english: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said: 'Thy sons and thy daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother's house;

19.hebrew: וְהִנֵּה רוּחַ גְּדוֹלָה בָּאָה מֵעֵבֶר הַמִּדְבָּר, וַיִּגַּע בְּאַרְבַּע פִּנּוֹת הַבַּיִת, וַיִּפֹּל עַל-הַנְּעָרִים, וַיָּמוּתוּ; וָאִמָּלְטָה רַק-אֲנִי לְבַדִּי, לְהַגִּיד לָךְ.
19.english: And, behold, there came a great wind from across the wilderness, and smote the four corners of the house, and it fell upon the young people, and they are dead; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.'

20.hebrew: וַיָּקָם אִיּוֹב וַיִּקְרַע אֶת-מְעִלוֹ, וַיָּגָז אֶת-רֹאשׁוֹ; וַיִּפֹּל אַרְצָה, וַיִּשְׁתָּחוּ.
20.english: Then Job arose, and rent his mantle, and shaved his head, and fell down upon the ground, and worshipped;

21.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר עָרֹם יָצָתִי מִבֶּטֶן אִמִּי, וְעָרֹם אָשׁוּב שָׁמָּה--יְהוָה נָתַן, וַיהוָה לָקָח; יְהִי שֵׁם יְהוָה, מְבֹרָךְ.
21.english: And he said; naked came I out of my mother's womb, and naked shall I return thither; the LORD gave, and the LORD hath taken away; blessed be the name of the LORD.

22.hebrew: בְּכָל-זֹאת, לֹא-חָטָא אִיּוֹב; וְלֹא-נָתַן תִּפְלָה, לֵאלֹהִים.  {פ}
22.english: For all this Job sinned not, nor ascribed aught unseemly to God. {P}
